review_body: Wonderful hotel, situated in one of the best spots in NY, Columbus Circle, with great services and comfort! The hotel's bar / restaurant is a separate chapter: a happy point for a senior executive, serving the best old fashioned Big Apple!

Brilliant stay, attentive service , best breakfast in New York , love the pancakes and can’t pick a better location , so east to get to mid town and Central Park for a walk or jogging Of a morning , bar is still empty but i stay here every year

Great escape from the city, beautifully appointed rooms that are comfortable, the bathrooms are like visiting a spa. Close to Central Park & great shopping. The staff goes above & beyond to make your stay memorable. This is luxury at its finest!

What better hotel to choose to stay in this fascinating city: indisputably this one!No negative comments, the staff is attentive, discreet, we are wonderfully welcomed, everything is done to feel at home

We dropped in for breakfast. Excellent service and glorious food in good size portions. Endless coffee and fruit juice. Superb range of menu and all beautifully presented. A very special family breakfast celebration for our daughter’s 19th Birthday.

Beautiful hotel in a great location. The staff does not meet four seasons quality or standard. All of the front desk seemed like they were in training. They were un informed and very unexperienced. Difficult to get amything done with them. Doormen were great!

Stay here during new year holiday. Couldn't fault a thing. Concierge, front desk, restaurant, housekeeping, spa are all great. Very classy environment and room is very comfortable as well. Wonderful view (if you have a high floor, you have a good view no matter to which direction)Location is prime for central park and shopping. Breakfast is good as well.

In the heart of Billionaire's Row, this hotel is just beautiful. The rooms, for New York, are surprisingly spacious. The service is always perfect - we loved The Garden for brunch too. There's no pool, but I enjoyed the bath in my room, as well as the spa facilities too.

I have stayed at many 5* hotels in the city but none are true 5 * this is truly a 5* ....every aspect of the hotel is outstanding there is nothing that they cannot offer you. I would not stay anywhere else!!

I’ll just quickly echo others and confirm this is a classic, luxurious, friendly and very comfortable hotel. We booked through Amex and received a lovely upgrade. We enjoyed breakfast on site, which was good. The friendly, kind staff make you feel very welcome. We plan to return.

I come to New York very often from DC on business, The Four Seasons is Where it is at. The best service, The staff is so caring, and helpful. I tell everyone I know how amazing it is here. Whenever I am in New York this is the only place I stay at.

review_body: Four Seasons Midtown New York is in a great location. The hotel and room was well appointed and very updated and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The Concierge Staff made our New York stay much more enjoyable by getting dining reservations and travel needs. Access in and out of the hotel to the city is easy and the elevators are quick and punctual.

I go to New York for work purposes throughout the year. I always annoy my manager to book this exceptional hotel for my stay. The quality and service is always outstandingly brilliant. I am really looking forward to our next visit which is in a few days

This is our second stay here. We brought our family for a vacation in NYC. Everything was perfect! We enjoyed breakfast in the room, the bathroom has a huge tub and the beds were very comfortable. Highly recommend this place!

Quality of food was poorRoom was nice and cleanLocation is good You have to take stairs to reach the reception,not convenient for traveller with hand carry luggageBusiness centre is not in a convenient location

Great stay, one of the most spacious rooms in NYC. Breakfast is delicious with Japanese food options though some are not on the breakfast menu but are available in the in room dining option (cam be ordered for restaurant diniing, subject to a wait). Breakfast is expensive and waiters may offer you many options such as pancake with bacon on the side. These are not a set and each is subject to charge.

I LOVE the four seasons. If I could afford it, I would stay here on every vacation, The staff treats you like royalty, even if you are not (and there are plenty of glitzy people they could choose above you). I went for my birthday, and they bent over backwards to meet my accommodations. As others have said, the higher floors are better, although it comes at a price. But whatever floor you choose, everyone is there to help you maximize your experience with pampering.Props to all the concierges who helped with my multiple restaurant changes and to....I don't know his name but he brought Champagne and ...wait his name was Rocky!...he danced with us when we played the theme to Rocky. Fun people, ready to pamper, but not to stuffy to let their hair down if you ask.

I had the opportunity to stay at this beautiful property since my daughter is a 4S employee and was taking advantage of comp nights. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcomed and valued. The room was ready a bit earlier and for a junior suite in NYC, really quite commodious with a Queen bed, sleeper sofa, arm chair and television. Lighting is perfect for reading in bed! Bathroom was done in marble and the shower was great, along with high end toiletries very generously sized. Special note must be given to the concierge staff, one of whom went above and beyond. Just a wonderful spot in a great midtown location!

We love all FS and this one is very nice. Go ahead and book the best room you can afford. Hotel staff is more than amazing. From arranging our travel to and from LGA to the great room service everything is perfect.

The best location, bar, staff and food!The concierge is superb! Hotel is beautiful and rooms are so comfortable. Our family always stays at The Four Seasons! The spa and fitness area is fantastic! This location has great restaurants nearby: Avra, Harry Cipriani, Nello, Vaucluse, Majorelle, La Goulue and Serafina Always. Great shopping: only 1 block from Bergdorf Goodman, 1 block from Madison with all the Boutiques. We love The Four Seasons!

Want to recognize concierge for doing an amazing job in taking care of our needs prior to arrival; car service, restaurant reservations, etc. From the moment we arrived everything was handled professionally. Our room was very nice and large bathroom. Wish our view was better but can’t complain. Great bar and restaurant. If you love to shop this is the area to stay! Walking distance to stores, park and restaurants. Will be back

The Four Seasons NYC was absolutely amazing! The room was huge and fabulous, and the service was over the top! The location was within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, and the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade. My family of 4 had a wonderful time!

We stayed at Four Seasons New York for a week between 12-19 Nov. 2019. The experience was great. Everything went so smoothly. Large, comfortable rooms, Great staff. Great concierge..Great location. The only negative point that can be mentioned is the high breakfast prices at the Garden Rest.

A very nice hotel - but when breakfast runs over £100 - it seems a tad high. The lack of a restaurent for dinner was also very dissapointing. On the plus side - nice rooms and the hotel is situated in a great location.

As a long time user of Four Seasons properties around the world, we were looking forward to staying at the NYC 57th St. property for four nights in mid November 2019. We were not disappointed. It was, as we understand it, renovated from a former Regent hotel, and like many such NYC properties, the overall building/elevator etc. is older. But the rooms have been brought forward. Plenty of plugs for charging, his/her separate clothes alcoves, good minibar, small sitting area with sofa table, separate desk. We asked for an additional small fridge for our yogurts, drinks etc., as they seemed reluctant to just empty the mini bar fridge, and they promptly provided the extra small fridge. Good bathroom, though unlike many Four Season properties, there is only one sink in the vanity and no separate WC. Although on 8th floor facing 57th Street, it was not noisy and sleep quality (including, especially the beds, linens, pillows) were excellent. Very expensive.

The staff makes this hotel. Many of them have been there since the beginning and they treat you feel like a part of the family. We moved from the Mandarin Oriental (which was horrible) and we were greeted with a super easy check in, a suite upgrade and had a fabulous weekend. Our room was spacious, with a side view of Central Park. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning and a nightcap at the bar every night. The gym is great. Can't beat the location. The concierge was great and helped us with dinner reservations. The hotel is a little dated, but who cares with such lovely people to help you. My only complaints are that we were behind the elevators which was fine at night, but the noise was annoying during the day and they don't give you water with turn down service unless you request it. Tiny, first world problems.

4 Seasons in NYC is always a good experience. While the decor is not necessarily my taste..the rooms and spacious, great closet configuration, nice bathroom...Been staying there for years and it never fails to be a positive experience.

I have been staying at this hotel for at least 15 years now. The location is terrific. Right near all the best shopping and the park, makes it easy to walk to where you need to go. Service is second to none, and is my favorite aspect of this hotel. If you need your make-up done, need flowers, show tickets, whatever you can imagine, they will make it happen. Over the years I have always marveled at how polite and capable the front desk staff is despite some obnoxious guests, and how the concierge staff really have the knowledge that you need to make your stay seamless. Room service is delicious and I always look forward to their Japanese breakfast. The rooms are very comfortable, beautifully decorated, and if you are willing to pay the extra, you can have lovely views of the park or the city. The only downside, as with all things in New York City, is the cost. Whenever I can afford to stay there, I do, it is my first choice.

review_body: Stay a lot of FS. The lobby and bar are beautiful and the rooms are the typical FS standards. Views are excellent and our room was very quiet. Amenities are similar to other hotels in the same level along with staff. Gym is great along with spa. Excellent massage. Here's what I didn't like about the hotel: No water left at bedside. No nespresso or other coffee in room. Overpriced for room. Lacking of amenities such as a nail file or razor (like the Ritz). Minimal towels. Bed didn't seem like the usual great FS bed and bedding. For a large suite, only one toilet. Food, like the hotel, is very expensive and good, but not for the price. No little store in the lobby - what's up with the odd beenie babies?

This place is amazing.Hotel is good. can't fault it so far..everyone friendly. Service is good. a little bit different to the uk london service. but all good! Looking forward to the next two weeks here.

I have never been a big fan of this hotel, it seems a little too bland for my taste, and the rates don't justify the decor and services (no pool, restaurant closed for dinner), when they remodeled a few years ago, they call all the rooms "junior suites" in an attempt to charge over $1,100 a night for the entry level room, which makes the guest feel gouged. No specials to be had at this location, even the Park Hyatt, Baccarat, Peninsula, and St Regis sell in the $600-$800 a night range at times, not here...Top dollar prices year round.

We left The Mark hotel early because our room was so shabby and hoped to stay at the Four Seasons downtown, which is absolutely 5-star worthy. They were booked, unfortunately, so we opted for the Four Seasons in midtown. For this price (over $1200), we just expected more. The room was adequate, but nothing extraordinary. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was spacious. Shower didn't drain well and had visible mold. Staff was kind, but disorganized. The room didn't come with any complimentary bottles of water and we had to call FIVE TIMES (no joke) before we finally got two tiny bottles of water. Turndown service was totally missed our first night, so we had to call again to get another two bottles of water. Surprisingly, the rooms at the FS don't include an iron and no coffee maker. Mini bar offered a very small selection of snacks. Finally, there are no shops in the lobby (that I could see), but there is a tiny room off the reception desk that displays and sells nothing but Beanie Babies... this is totally out of place for a Four Seasons property and looks really tacky. Still searching for a 5-star worthy hotel in midtown Manhattan. This isn't it.

FS NY is a gorgeous architectural hotel with a cathedral lobby and beautifully, simply, elegantly plush apartment style rooms in the sky. But, there a serious problems here.THE GOODThe location is terrific and the lobby is stunning. The room redesign is deceptively simple in muted tones. I had a corner Park Avenue Suite which was huge and airy with lovely high quality furniture and a residential feel. Nice the way the set up has a walk in closet, bar and spacious bathroom (odd it doesn’t have two sinks). The room service laundry and shoeshine were very fast and friendly. The concierge was good. That’s it for the good stuff.THE BADThe food is average but priced higher than London or Hong Kong. You can’t charge the prices they do and serve uninspired not so great food. Over five days, I had one dish I loved and would eat again - an Arctic char special. The Cobb salad is weird, the açaí bowl tastes bland, the omelette had no flavor, the croissants weren’t top notch, the kale salad was something I could get at Tender Greens, the Asian tuna salad wasn’t ahi as advertised and drowning in soy sauce. The list goes on and on. I love good food and will pay for it. But, I don’t care where I am - I won’t pay $250 for lunch for two without alcohol again and have an average meal. The receptionist who checked me was very harried and almost nervous. She forgot to give me the mini bar key. No fresh flowers in a $1,700 a night room, just fake orchids. Oh and the famous acacia trees in the lobby’s Garden restaurant are all fake. The servers are well intentioned but um shall we say not very polished.THE UGLYThere’s one reason I probably will never stay at this hotel again - ELEVATOR NOISE. I was on the 36th floor with only three or four other rooms and expecting a tranquil escape every evening. But NO given the structure of the building every room is adjacent to the old elevator shafts and all your hear is swooshing and cables rattling and the shaft creaking. I felt like I was in Blade Runner with jets flying over all night and had to sleep with ear plugs. Most of the staff is cold in personality. Also what is up with two loose sheets around a comforter. Why is there no duvet cover? Why do you have to ask for an espresso machine? Why is the shower water pressure so weak with no rain shower? Why do I hear the super loud suction toilets in other rooms? And why oh why can’t you have a proper dinner in a nice restraint at a hotel of this supposed caliber? It’s bar food or room service. That is ridiculous. Joel Robuchon left over 5 years ago and there’s yet to be a replacement. Absurd I loved the room but I didn’t like this hotel at all.

Our stay in this hotel was so nice.We arrived earlier as plannend and they gave us a room without extra payment. The hotel was very big and beautiful, i was in love with the decoratien.The rooms were big and very beautiful. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. We really enjoyed our stay in New York and ofcourse in this hotel.We hope to get back soon in New York and absolutly in this hotel again.

A beautiful hotel , a great location but don t expect the usual FS standards of service, way overratedIn room dining was extraordinaly expensive ,the staff lacked proper training and the food was very average.Surpised that such a large property does not even offer an onsite restaurant for the evening.

I have stayed at the Four Season New York a dozen times over 25 years. My most recent visit was good bu some areas needed improvement. Firstly I was greeted well at front desk and check in was satisfactory. My bags arrived in my room in a reasonable amount of time. the room was very nice. I went downstairs and spoke to the concierge to organise my dinner reservations. It took nearly an hour for them to confirm. On leaving the room there were flower peddles on the floor I told the desk on the way out. We came back from dinner at 11pm and they were still there. Check out was fast and efficent and breakfast was fantastic. Overall this is a very good hotel and Iwill consider it when I return to New York.

This is luxury at it's finest. We were warmly greeted by the doorman as soon as our car pulled up. Everyone we encountered during our stay was friendly and greeted us warmly. Our room (Junior Suite, 21st fl) had views of the city with limited views of Central Park but was immaculate. Well stocked mini bar with snacks. You had to pay for them but that's with every hotel. The hotel sent up a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary, which was a nice surprise. We had concierge (Emmanuel) set up dinner reservations and arrange for a car for a night out and every thing was perfect. Will definitely recommend to everyone. Can't wait to go back.

The service in the breakfast restaurant is excellent. The food itself is tired last century midtown. Front desk is also great. Service in the room is bad. I can’t believe that they don’t automatically leave bottles of water by the bedside at turn down. I had to beg for water virtually every night. The internet service requires a pay upgrade to get anything useful....seriously in a very expensive room. Also they turn on all of the lights after servicing the room and leave them on all day. Then there is no switch to turn them all off. So i was a slave to their need to have all the lights on all the time. The bar area “ty” is frumpy and old. The service at the tables is good but ham fisted. The bar tenders lack any creativity. The ambiance is “waiting room”.... bar tenders are semi retired. For a hotel this expensive they are just checking the blocks all around. There are far better hotels in NYC. This one is resting on its reputation with its clientele.

Stayed for a week at Four Seasons for a business trip. Pro-I like that the hotel is located centrally and we could walk everywhere. Room is huge, clean and has all the amenities you need. Staff are friendly as well. Hskeeping staff is attentive and placed a linen on the counter for my wet items instead of using a face towel (like I did)Cons-It’s odd because I set “privacy please” for my rooms and Housekeeping always enters to clean. Not sure if it was a technical fault but I was pretty frustrated and called front desk for two days straight when the situation didn’t improve. Breakfast was pretty meh. Not many food options.

Nice hotel in good area for restaurants/things to do, but way overpriced compared to other quality hotels in the area. $1200 per night for a basic room makes you scratch your head! Service was the typically perfect Four Seasons experience. By far the most expensive Four Seasons where I’ve ever stayed — cocktails were great, but they should be for $24 each.

It is not common to have a spacious hotel room in NY. This is is a very confortable and large room. Also, the hotel itself is beautiful, breakfast is excellent, and service is impressive. It also has a bar that serves delicious bites and drinks. The people at the concierge were very helpful and eager to arrange reservations for wherever we wanted to go. We had an outstanding experience!

I always try to stay at a 4 Seasons hotel when traveling because I know that their first priority is to make sure their guests are happy and properly taken care of. Their entire brand is based on top notch customer service. If there are problems (which are few and far between), the hotel will make sure they are resolved to your satisfaction. I have very high standards and very high expectations when I am staying at a 5-star hotel and paying 5-star prices. That being said, I was extremely pleased with my most recent stay at the hotel. My room (a Gotham Junior Suite) was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a large “dressing room” area. There is even a large shelf for your luggage in the dressing room so you do not need a luggage rack. The hotel manager, Michal Dedera, was always available to provide personal attention if needed and extremely responsive to one’s needs. You can always tell that a hotel cares about its guests by the responses on TripAdvisor. I always consult TripAdvisor before choosing a hotel and was extremely impressed that the hotel General Manager, Rudy Tauscher, took the time to respond to all the complaints in an extremely caring and sincere manner. For all the above reasons, the Four Seasons is my “go to” hotel in any city, and the Four Seasons Midtown did not disappoint. P.S. The breakfast waffles are the best I have ever had in my life anywhere and are another reason I always look forward to a stay at the Four Seasons Midtown 

Superior architecture design, radiates through out this hotel of choice. Staff were professional, engaging and always at your service. We are frequent international travellers who appreciate excellence and outstanding service. Four Seassons NYC offers outstanding and noteworthy perfection in every area of this hotel. TY Bar is brilliant. Garden restraunt provides multiple delightful choices any time of the day/night. Four Seasons is now our residence of choice where ever in the world we may travel.

You will be pleased with The Four Seasons if you love service. They know what they’re doing. You don’t feel the need to advise or teach. They know and they make the effort every time. From the very warm welcoming from the doormen to the bartenders to the room service people. Always a pleasure.

We've always stayed at the Palace Towers when in NYC but after our recent stay at the Four Season's in mid-town it's now our "go to" place! The rooms post-renovation are bright, airy and comfortable but what really sets it apart is the quality of their service and attention to detail. We enjoyed our trip so much we booked another in November and the wonderful Concierges were able to secure excellent seats to a couple of top shows. Can't wait to get back to the Four Seasons!

We always stay at the Four Seasons when in New York (or anywhere they have a hotel). Always the very very best. This time there were some issues beyond their control (ConEdison working on a gas pipe which meant no hot water in the whole area), but these people handle the most complicated issues with the utmost elegance. We also own hotels, and these are the most complicated issues to deal with.

First class service, good food in-room dining, fantastic location.I was unimpressed with the decor of my room but you can easily forget it while enjoying amazing bed and bed linen, massive bath and taps with very good water pressure (I usually avoid high floors because of low water pressure in showers but here was nicely surprised).Shame there is no proper restaurant in the hotel ( bar in the lobby and a breakfast/lunch place only), but concierge is happy to book a restaurant outside - plenty to choose from.No swimming pool but there’s a gym and a spa. Excellent place to stay for business or shopping trips.

A supreme hotel in New York City. Outstanding location, exquisite spaces, and top service. Not inexpensive, but the difference in rooms, hospitality and services is very impressive. Highly recommended.

Excellent hotel. We’ve stayed in many of the luxury hotels in New York and have decided this is “our hotel.” Every member of the staff was extraordinarily helpful and courteous. Food was great. Concierge staff is the best in the city.

As expected, flawless service, gorgeous accommodations, unmatched atmosphere. Food was amazing at the lounge bar, as well as in room dining. From the doorman, to the front desk, to the drivers. Everyone performed as you’d expect & deserve from an elite hotel.

Just an excellent property. Walking distance to major attractions. Walk to Central Park. Excellent breakfast and concierge services. Everyone is very attentive to your comfort and makes you feel at home.

The Four Seasons staff is so attentive and really know how to make guests feel extra special. So, thank you to every single staff member that I encountered during this trip because I left feeling grateful to have stayed here during my trip to New York and to have met such caring people. My visit was nothing short of incredible.

The Four Seasons New York Is an outstanding hotel, offering excellent service, comfort, cleanliness and remarkable courtesy from the staff. It is a beautiful place to stay, and very well located in mid-town Manhattan. I would also recommend the room service because the food is exceptional and so is the service.

We stayed in FS NY while I was traveling away post birth, and still breastfeeding. I requested many things since I needed to store, sterilize and pump during my stay. Between the sterilizer, fridge (yes an extra freezer), microwave - I knew I asked for many things and they were absolutely helpful. Never saying no - always we will do our best, or simply yes. No problems.The incident was during the stay; I needed to store my breastmilk in their freezer (when it was full in the room), and to have them packed up with dry ice etc otw back to Indonesia. Thats a solid 24-26 hrs of travel time. I know how to do this, what I need etc. Now from all of the ones I sent down, quite a large amount in one pile was not stored properly by them. So they melted and I had to throw them away. Believe me when I say for most mothers out there - these are liquid gold. And the most precious thing we can give. So in sadness I told them about what happened. The concierge immediately apologized, immediately tried to ask what can they do, or help with. I said nothing, I cannot refreeze them. No joke, i had about 50oz worth thats damaged.Now - they sent me after that an email apologizing again. They gave me a voucher worth significant enough to stay for a night in any FS or to use it against room and food. But what made it more actionable for me was asking, do I remember who I gave the milk to and when - because they want to ensure it never happened again to anyone. I found this to be a very good gesture. Will definitely come back.

Rooms are very spacious and well designed and equipped and though this is a bit expensive but worth it. Big THANK YOU

My corner suite was simply perfect the only thing i would ask is to have a true full blackout room but besides that it was great. The spa was nice and had sauna and steam room but nothing spectacular, just nice. Great location and fantastic lobby bar with great duo playing at that time.

Hotel is always great. Always clean and professional. We heard they will be renovating soon and can’t wait to visit again. Our daughter enjoyed the food and the service and the front seat is always nice and friendly

I booked this hotel because of location and reputation. I was disappointed. Everything should be perfect.1) Internet was so slow as to be unusable. I barely got 1.5 Mpbs on the $25 per day "high speed"2) Room smelled like cigarette smoke.

From the moment I walked through the doors, I was welcomed. The staff is fabulous and the hotel is the best Four Seasons I have been to in the US. My room was clean and the housekeeper came at the perfect time while I was away. I had a special request and she promptly assisted me.

The Four Seasons is a wonderful property with very caring associates. If you want a luxury experience, you should definitely keep this property in mind. We have stayed at other luxury hotels and the Four Seasons ranks right there on service, room amenities and hospitality.

This is a very good place to hang out and relax over a couple of drinks. It exudes luxury and class. It’s Four Seasons and the name alone says much about what to expect ! Only the BEST !!!Drop by for a visit !.........and a drink !

We wanted it to be perfect and it was ! Great staff, excellent location. We know NY has many facets but 1 week isn't much and after spending days queuing in museum and other crowded activities (Liberty Island, Empire state building ...) it was good to be welcomed back and this fabulous property with excellent service.

Concierge and wait staff are first class. Especially the gentleman at the concierge with the frosted tips. Treated us like gold! The doormen are also great. We arrived way before check in time, and they still managed to get us into our room! This place is worth every nickel!

I really like the Four Seasons brand. Been in many and always been satisfied with the experience. We are visiting New York and for Easter night I wanted to pamper my wife with a night in this hotel vs the flat we are staying at.We took a Gotham Suite and we were given one on the 11th Floor. So ... no view.The lobby is majestic, service impeccable as always.The newly refurbished room (and corridors) were a bit disappointing - they could have done more to make it less corporate. It's clean, simple... very large rooms... but so anonymous. From a Four Seasons I was expecting more luxury, more treats... and I just found it very blend... and room service (as anything in this Country)... it's the usual rip-off.

Staff was very friendly and attentive. Concierge was excellent. We really enjoyed the terrace, room service and being driven in the house Rolls Royce. The staff was wonderfully accommodating. You made my son’s birthday special with a surprise, delicious chocolate cake and champagne!

We usually stay at The NY Palace but this was a fabulous positive change. The staff, every single one of them I came across were ALWAYS friendly, courteous, helpful and kind. This was an extremely positive experience. We felt welcomed, we were taken care of, our room was super spacious and modern. We loved our stay here. We will be back here for sure.

My wife and I were made to feel at home by every single member of staff. We felt that we were amongst friends the whole time we were there. It will always be our hotel of choice in Manhattan. You can’t help but smile the whole time you are there.

I spent with my family a couple of nights in Four Seasons New York in March this year . The quality of services was outstanding ! A friendly and warm atmosphere , excellent food. A teem real focused on customer satisfaction. Thank you ! D. R.

Four seasons was quite great. It was just a 3mins walk from time square. We walked up and down everyday. The room was neither very big nor very small. It was moderate. Overall it was a really great experience staying!

I stayed for 2 days and I found it very expensive both room / extra and food. 300$ for a normal breakfast for 4 people is something I had never seen. 17$ a capuccino. But the lunch was good and service nice and smiley. I think they increased prices because I was there 4 years ago and it was not that expensive.

I visit many hotel. Most of them are good, but few are as good as this. This hotel set the standards for high quality staff, rooms, restaurants, everything. I stayed only 2 nights and I will back there for sure. Room is not only clean, efficient and comfortable, but is also very good. Colors and forniture gives a comfy feeling. View from windows is breathtaking.Nothing to say more. It set standards and it’s hard to find something better in terms of professionalism.

Another amazing 3 nights Valentines weekend. We joined our cousin and had a wonderful time at the FS. Emmanuel was a wonderful concierge and Rodman is a Rock Star!!The breakfast was lovely but very expensive. The Bar has more standard prices for drinks and they are delicious as is the food and bar snacks. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious. The service is always 5 star.

What a perfect way to celebrate Valentine’s Day! From the hotels amazing location for shopping or just walks through Central Park, to the beauty of the hotel itself .. great vibe,food and cocktails. Their beautiful guest rooms with incredible views .. all the way to the entire staff that couldn’t be nicer or more helpful... Everyone and everything was PERFECTION!!!

I'm a huge fan of the brand and in general all the locations are more than satisfactory. I strongly suggest the downtown location though. Midtown is mediocre and not to Four Seasons standards. Be advised.

review_body: We stayed for a few nights while touring the city and visiting friends. Nice and comfortable. A short walk from all we wanted to visit.Comfortable rooms with excellent beds. Room service was on par as well.

It was on the bucket list to go to the 4 Seasons. I’m a working registered nurse of a teenager. We cane to new York for the first time. The hotel was nice but the concierge clancey and Rodman made the trip special. Thank you for your welcome warm ness kindness talking with myself and my 17 yr old daughter, the laughs the suggestion reservations. I told my daughter see there are still good people in this world!

I truly enjoyed my stay. Look, it's a GREAT hotel. It does lack character. The rooms are small but big by NYC standards. The prices are of course ridiculous but if you're watching your wallet you shouldn't be anywhere near this place, so no complaining - it's part of the deal. The location is nice, on the east side midtown, you can get to everything. The Room Service is PHENOMENAL. The bath is fantastic - water pressure to die for. The staff helpful. It doesn't leave an impression, which is sometimes a good thing. In NYC for a grand a night there are a lot of good options. This is one that will not seriously disappoint you, and if you're having a great time in the city it will not get in the way in any fashion. I can't give it that 5th star, but that's a personal thing I guess - I can't really come up with a reason it's not my absolute fave, but maybe it's like that really great looking person you didn't marry - you love 'em or you don't. We left on great terms and I hope the Four Seasons NYC finds that man she's looking for!

review_body: We’ve been there after one of our friend recommended us this hotel. Sooooo in love, exactly what we was looking for. Couldn’t go wrong. I got in love with this hotel, the staff, the food. Can’t wait to be back. Much love! Highly recommend!

review_body: this is the best lobby in New York hotels the location is a little. bid hiddenyou have to walk. towards. 5th near Madisson and 57 st but once you find the way it is. easyalso a good. place for meetingsnice lobby bars

Wonderful stay! Large luxury rooms and wonderful professional staff. Food was pricey. Great location but not in a crazy busy area being just down the street from 5th Ave. We will definately make this our go to hotel when in NYC.

The hotel charm is incredible, location is great. The Staff extremely kind in supporting us on our arrival (unfortunately with hours of delay due to flight problem) adapting our length of stay on the fly without extra-charge. The chat service through the official App is extremely useful, it's possible to contact all the services of the hotel as if you are in-person at the hotel. The Concierge Staff is highly prepared to meet all your needs, support for changing reservations of activities in the city, moreover great suggestions for amazing dinners in NYC. Rooms are very clean, bed extremely comfortable and bathroom bright and spacious.In-room dining very well presented, great attention to details. Breakfast at The Garden restaurant delicious and very flexible to meet dietary requirements or special requests.24h Laundry service very precise in terms of timing of delivery even on 31st December for Tuxedo and Cocktail Dress Press Service.Four Seasons reputation is second to none!

I came to the hotel to spend New Year's Eve with my husband. We stayed for 3 nights and were overall disappointed in our experience. The staff definitely tried to make our stay enjoyable but the hotel has some issues. When we arrived I asked for a quiet room away from the elevators. We were told they had a quiet room but it was not ready despite us arriving after check in time. They apologized and offered us complimentary drinks at the bar while we waited. When we checked into our room we noticed it had a cigarette smell. I was also very disappointed that my white coat had gotten pen on it while it was transported by the bellmen. Additionally our supposed "quiet room" was across from the housekeeping closet. We had limited time to get ready for our evening so we notified the staff about my coat and hoped the smell would go away. When we returned that night we were pleased that my coat had been taken away and we received an amenity of fruit and wine. The next day the cigarette smell remained in our room. We notified the front desk and were provided with an air purifier machine. We kept the machine running for the remainder of our trip but the smell continued. It was very unusual to stay in a five star hotel and have a Honeywell air purifier machine going the whole time. No one checked on us about the smell. My coat did return cleaned. I enjoyed a blow out in the hair salon. We enjoyed working out in the gym but keep in mind it is very small. The location is great! Overall I expected more from this luxury chain. I would not stay here again.

My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons in Midtown right after Christmas. Expensive room rates but the hotel and the service epitomize the saying "you get what you pay for." Great front desk, concierge, housekeeping and overall service! Rooms are big, luxurious and nicely updated. Easy to use room controls. The only downsides are that they gouge you for fast wi-fi ($25/day when you've paid $1,100 a night for a room!). In addition, to charge you $54 for eggs and bacon and then tell you that you get "one glass of juice" for that rate is kind of shameless. They would curry much more guest favor to provide you with fast wi-fi for free and reduce some of the restaurant prices.

As traditions go, NYC during the Holidays is especially magical. Enhancing that magic is the Four Seasons. For a number of years now, we've made the Four Seasons our home for the days preceding Christmas, as we enjoy all that New York has to offer. Everyone is committed to complete guest satisfaction. Friendly, discerning and a genuine warmth is palpable. I would particularly like to say thanks to Chris, the Bell Captain, who has extended such kindness during every stay. Helen in Concierge Services was also very accommodating with flight schedules, delays and arranging transportation. The Hotel's location is perfect for shopping and dining. Thanks for, once again, making a special trip, all the more special!!!

Terrible service, completely ignored during our entire stay. Not what is usually expected by my wife and I when we stay at the Four Seasons. I would suggest another hotel chain if you’re looking for attention and excellent service.

Whenever I stay at the NYC 57st Fourseasons, whether for business or pleasure...everything goes smooth because of the way we are treated. The staff is top notch and every request is handled with the utmost personal care.

We had 10 people that stayed three nights and we were very happy with the hotel. We have stayed there in the past and the service is always impeccable. Rooms clean and well decorated. The hotel bar is our favorite around. Great location.

We stayed at the four seasons in a Junior Suite with a view of central park for our 10th anniversary. While we payed a heavy premium for this room and the view, the personalized attention and beautiful hotel made the trip more than memorable. I do think the view is a little oversold though (while any view in New York is a plus, calling it a "Central Park view" when there are several buildings in the way and you can see basically a corner of the park is a little misleading. We did overall enjoy our stay and think it was worth it for something like a big anniversary.

Had a relaxing stay at Four Season Hotel, great central location. Room was excellent. The room service and hotel staff were very friendly. Got to do some shopping. The restaurant and bar have excellent choices.

This is a great location; the hotel is beautifully decorated and clean, rooms were recently updated and the updates are nice. The staff was polite but not very friendly or welcoming, the hotel does not feel very large, however the experience was such that we were just faceless guests, rarely acknowledged.

Having stayed at all of the 5 star hotels in NY, I can say without reservation that the Four Seasons on 57th Street is the best. Friendly and helpful staff; comfortable rooms with large windows to the City; expensive, but worth it. Reopening the dining restaurant with a Michelin three star or equivalent would be an plus.

had a gotham junior suite, felt like this suite had been a rush job only hotel i have ever stayed in in a suite that only has one sink in the bathroom felt very claustraphobic in the bathroom. furniture very sparse not like on th epictures on the website with the flowers in the room etc. the reason i am totally disgusted with this hotel was on my last day went to the bar had two drinks one alcaholic one non alcaholic everyone else around me had been given olives snacks etc with there drinks i was offered nothing when i asked for the bill was bought in the little black wallet my bill was 53 dollars i gave 60 the waiter took the money never once comming back with my change just assumed that he had earnt a tip when he had done nothing n any way shape or form apart from his job i think this is very assumptious of the staff here and totally not what i expect in a five star hotel tipping is not automatic in my book you need to do something other than your job to get a tip

staff, food and room incredible. I was stranded in Manhattan during a sleetstorm and this was the only decent place with a room.First time stay but I will definitely come back. Incredible place in all respects.

So, I normally stay at Ritz Carlton hotels. I have stayed at the one in Central Park and Battery Park. I wanted to switch it up for once. The interior of the hotel was very nice. My junior suite was very beautiful. However, they definitely want to rob you for every penny you're worth, though you're already paying $1200 a night. So, at every Ritz I have ever stayed at, they give you a bunch of little water bottles. Here, every time you ORDER bottled water, they charge you $8 for one that contains 3-4 sips or $11 for one that contained 9-10 sips. Maybe the water was made of gold? I must've been missing something. Also, we got breakfast: an omelette, some egg combo, and a pot of coffee. $150. Two pieces of cheesecake that had maybe four bites to them each and some water: $85. Normally, when you stay at a hotel that charges these kinds of prices, they are very accommodating. Also, we got tickets for a broadway show on the wrong night and the concierge helped us get ones for the right night. However, we still had to pay for the other tickets. When we talked to the box office, they said that through ticketmaster (which is where the tickets were purchased), you can easily just exchange your tickets in about three easy steps. They even gave us a piece of paper with the basic details of how to go about this. The concierge told us that the only guarantee we could have would be buying new tickets and then trying to get a refund from the box office. Well, that wasn't the case, and we wished we had known that before having to purchase totally brand new tickets. Overall, the staff was friendly and the hotel was nice, but there are much better, more accommodating places to stay in New York. The best part is that most other places don't charge for water! Stay hydrated, my friends! I would recommend somewhere else!

Recently spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons on 57th Street and it was fantastic. From the front desk to the Concierge to the rooms, all were top notch and we were made to feel known and cared for. Will return.

I've stayed at a lot of Four Seasons....This one by far is the nicest I've stayed at!! Staff is amazing! Rooms are big and beautiful, so comfortable, bathrooms are perfect! The food is excellent. If you want to treat yourself and can afford it :) I highly recommend staying there!!!

That’s the place I always choose in NYC for lunch as the atmosphere is very relax the service is really top with a great attention the food specially house burger are incredible yummy and after that I always take coffee à the bar on the same level on the opposite side

It's hard for me to not to enjoy spending time in New York. However the week at FS New York was one of a kind lifetime experiences. The hotel just oozes and the location couldn't be better. The rooms were incredibly spacious and the bath tub a must (on a blizzard day!) at breakfast at The Garden the service was flawless and very genuine. Love it from the beginning to the end of my stay. I took my parents for their first time in NYC and they just LOVED IT! Thank you FS NY!

My wife and I spent 3 nights at Four Seasons to visit NYC. The hotel is beautiful. The suite we had was spacious and beautiful. The staff were very helpful! The concierge helped us get dinner reservations that were awesome. Highly recommend. We will be back.

Two night stay for a wedding in late October.Very good location for all the major shopping on Fifth and Madison Avenues.Staff are professional and courteous and our porters were extremely helpful and friendly with moving luggage. Rooms are expensive, however are very large for central Manhattan. Amenities and bathrooms are very luxurious. We stayed in a junior Gotham suite on the 6th floor overlooking East 57th st. The only downside is that there is no accessory to play music in your room from a smartphone or way to stream your music to the smart TV. For this price of room a bluetooth speaker would be a nice addition.We were woken up early by some party revellers in the next door suite and a complaint to reception was upheld and noise was constantly monitored for the remainder of our stay which we appreciated. Used the fitness centre in the basement which was small, but had plenty of equipment for an all round workout. Free water, sports drinks and towels.Great hotel and stay, but for the price a few 2018 tech updates would have made this review Excellent.

Absolutely beautiful Hotel! I have stayed here 3 times and I cannot wait to return. Very elegant and the rooms are spacious and luxury bedding etc... high ceilings and you can get some nice views on higher floors. The hotel is also much quieter than most other hotels in NY. The staff is very friendly and they always remember my name! Tell the Brady Bunte sent you!

The structure is magnificent with a lobby second to none. The staff is equally good including the Concierge, Bell staff, Front Desk and Restaurant/ Bar staff, We had a junior suite which had to be close to 600 sq feet with a terrace overlooking 57th Street. The room was spotless, as was the rest of the hotel, and the furnishings were simple although the effect was mesmerizing'....a beautiful room. It was a joy spending an hour on the terrace on a balmy morning having coffee. Perfect to this point. The only negative is that housekeeping namely the turn down service which was a bit confused and inconsistent but not a major issue. Luxury hotels love their marble baths but fail to realize that marble is slippery when wet and they provide postage sized bath mats forcing the guest to use a bath towel to secure their footing. Fortunately the shower floor was not marble unlike the Shangri-La in London which seemed like an ice skating pond. Like most of the city, several derelicts were sleeping in doorways of retail stores. The city should do something about this plague of homeless and derelicts or it is really going to hurt tourism. This hotel is really special!

4 seasons may be slightly more expensive than other luxury hotels, but wow, so much better.Spacious room, luxurious bathroom with bathtub, twin aspect. Tastefully decorated. A bedroom for living in not just for sleeping like many of their competitors. Well equipped gym with 6 treadmills. Super bar area for relaxed dining next to the open fire. This place has had a $140m facelift according to the adds . I can well believe it. Superlative week for business or pleasure

I have visited New York on many occasions but this is the first time I have stayed at The Four Seasons. Everything was 5 star including the service from simply every member of staff. Nothing was too much trouble. I cannot recommend this hotel more highly.

Business trip in November. Great service and top notch quality rooms with impeccable clean rooms. The gym is quite small but has everything you need. The saunas are subpar and I would not recommend them. Otherwise, nothing to complain about.

Stayed here (having been told at The Royalton Park Lane & The Park Hyatt that even though we had booked and paid for a room at both places, see previous reviews) and it was very nice. Very expensive but after our ordeal, very nice. Luxurious and everything you’d expect from a Four Seasons Hotels

It is Disney without the Mouse. The staff is attentive and genuine. They are smart and you clearly see that. The one place I like in room dining. Everyone from the baggage clerk to the bartender to the managers are on it and it’s nice to be in good hands.

Given the Four Seasons brand, we had higher expectations for this experience than what was delivered. They seemed understaffed and there were basic accommodations that we expected which were not delivered. Given the options in NYC, we are likely to try another hotel before returning. It is a fantastic location.

Take advantage of the concierge service - no need to think or plan, they handle it for you. They know where to go and how to get you in. The bar is beautiful but the service even better. Many of the bar staff have been there for years and can also give you insight if you're traveling for leisure. The bed - was wonderful - some kind of technology that keeps it cool and comfortable. This was the honeymoon and wonderful. Thank you,

The newly remodeled rooms are very attractive. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The concierge staff will fulfill all you wishes with a professional attitude. I am looking forward to my next visit.

Lobby was really nice, however the rooms were very basic. We believe in your get what you pay for and this definitely did not fit the bill. We booked a King Suite. Our one and only sink was clogged when we arrived to the room. Super gross. Then the wall outlet we plugged our phone into was dead and as a result so was our phones. Caused us to miss a very important phone call and our alarm. I will say this though, the staff were simply amazing. Very warm and inviting. The room service was yummy. For NYC the rooms were larger than usual. But again just basic.

It’s a great property. No question. The rooms are beautiful, spacious (for Manhattan) and well-apportioned. It is perfectly situated in Midtown, close to Times Square, the Broadway theaters and Central Park. The concierge desk is second to none - super helpful and responsive, they will get you in anywhere you wish to go. But....For $1200 a night you expect this. What you don’t expect:1. No bottled watered in the room2. No iron or ironing board (my shirts get wrinkled in a suitcase - is this not a universal reality?)3. Poor access to cabs. I was told by a doorman, after 15 minutes of futility, to just call an Uber. This is New York. You can’t get a cab at the best hotel in Midtown?This is a great hotel. A few small things (attention to detail!) would enhance the experience and make it truly outstanding. Will definitely come back - just wish I felt like I received value for my dollar.

9 out of 10 times I stay here. Expensive yes but worth every dollar. You're in NY. You'll easily pay 500 dollars to stay at a mediocre hotel in a great location. So why not. I've stayed here over 2 dozen times for work and pleasure. From the breakfast to the cocktail bar, the rooms and spa. This hotel can't be beat when it comes to value vs money. The management team here is simply one of the best. Thank you for making each and every stay an experience to be remembered.

If you want to have the best dinner and cocktails you have ever had, go to the original Four Seasons on 57th. Great neighborhood and great service, as well as the impeccably styled hotel room and the great four seasons beds. The concierge is one of the best resources in the city and they know everyone. Cannot wait to go back.

I have personally becoming to this specific location for many years with my family. I continue to return because I believe it is the Perfect hotel. The service is spectacular and the employees no longer are seen that way through my eyes. They become an extension of your stay. My long history with the hotel and experience has always been spectacular and I am not easy to please. Continues Success. Sam Levinson

review_body: Four Seasons New York is one of the best hotels in the world. The service is unsurpassed and the property is wonderful. All rooms are exceptionally well-appointed. In addition, the rooms are very large for New York City. I highly recommend this property.

From the time we checked in to the time we departed, everything was looked after in meticulous fashion. The hotels location was perfect for easy convent access to a number of meetings we had as well as wonderful dining and entertainment options. Would highly recommend.

This hotel never ceases to impress. On this trip I was travelling alone with my teenage daughter and I felt in completely safe hands. The concierge has to be the best of any hotel I’ve stayed in, it’s not just down to one individual, they are all excellent; knowledgeable, helpful, patient, attentive...The doormen and bellboys are fabulous; always a friendly welcome, and they can’t do enough for you. We had breakfast in the hotel every morning, we didn’t want to go anywhere else, it was always a treat. The food was excellent, and any ‘off piste’ requests catered for. The best part however, was the staff - they went out of their way to look after us, in particular, Michael and Shueb.So we’re currently sitting having our last breakfast, soaking up the atmosphere before we step out to the shops - this isn’t my first visit to this hotel, and it certainly won’t be my last. Thank you Four Seasons for making our trip extra special.

I've stayed at many of the Four Seasons properties and have always been so pleased with this hotel brand. I just returned home from a three night stay at this stunning hotel with my husband who was in NYC working. From the moment we stepped out of the car until the moment we departed we were treated like royalty. Service was flawless as was the gorgeous hotel and the sumptuous room and view. We loved the bar, room service, breakfast, gorgeous bathroom, the location, the doormen were so friendly, I could go on and on. All the staff we encountered provided five star service. The beds were like clouds! I hated to leave and hope to return again very soon!

This hotel is new and very nice. Wonderful service, friendly staff, great food. Really good meeting spaces. Excellent location, convenient to everything. It was just a very comfortable stay. Good job W

This property was wonderful the staff make the place welcoming and the level of how the hotel is kept is top notch too. The location in the city is perfect and you really don’t need to shop around, keep life simple go with the sure thing!

Everytime I vist NYC, I prefer to stay in Fourseasons, they have excellent service and very personalized. My experience with Clancy from the Conceirge has been always great and very helpful during my visits. This time he helped me with arranging for US Open, without Clancy I could have not planned it.

The hotel is well operated as always with all the amenities and refinements one would expect from a hotel of this caliber. It is plush and the staff is very accommodating. A high is preferable given the location.

The Four Seasons NYC is an excellent hotel, conveniently located on the northern border of midtown - and yet, a safe distance from Times Square (albeit, very accessible to the theatre district and Central Park).

If you have the means for a luxury hotel in NYC, THIS is your hotel! The Four Seasons was the best experience we've had in New York. Their staff is second to none, the rooms are giant and have the most tastefully elegant finishes with any comfort you could imagine. Have I mentioned the staff? From the doormen to the guest services team at check-in to the concierge desk - ALL were magnificent and made us feel as though we were their only guests. We had 2 days of business meetings and 3 days of fun for this trip - all 4 nights were simply amazing! I can't say enough about our experience here. Thank you!

Our stay at the Four Seasons was fabulous! The service was great and our room was amazing! The entire staff was eager to make your stay as pleasant as possible. When you need local transportation a ride in their new Rolls Royce is the way to go! I highly recommend this hotel when staying in NYC!

Everything about the Four Seasons is fantastic. Everything is clean, modern, up to date, luxurious, so much attention to detail, and the staff is absolutely wonderful, they make you feel so welcome, so cared for, so pleasant, helpful, cheerful, really great people.

Will definitely be our go to hotel from now on. We were treated like family here! Everyone was polite and helpful! Cannot thank everyone enough for making this an amazing few days. We do not get away frequently and this made our trip fantastic! Kudos to everyone we met during our stay... Mike at the door thank you for being so kind... and to the trainee at the front desk ... I hope to see you again on our next trip! Thanks!

Between the peninsula, plaza, and FS we decided to stay at the four seasons. The FS is always the go to hotel for us as we can always rely on it being to the highest standard. This hotel is centrally located on top of the best shopping streets and walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. The hotel itself is very grand and very city like having over 50 floors. The rooms are clean, modern and visually appealing with the newest technology, best lighting, and magnificent views. But this hotel seemed to lack that four seasons service that other FS hotels have. It did not feel as warm and welcoming as other hotels do and some requests needed to be made twice before being completed. I don’t know if that is a result of the busy nature of the city or not but it definitely didn’t have that much loved four seasons service all the time. That’s not to say some of the staff were not welcoming and helpful because they were; just part of the time the service seemed not to be at that FS standard. All and all I would still choose to stay at this hotel over the others in NY.

Before we arrived, the Concierge team worked with us and secured transportation, tickets, restaurant reservations. This made us feel like we already had friends in New York! The way people treat children is a great indicator of their true values ... and they treated our eight year old granddaughter with respect and made her feel so special. Being so close to Central Park allowed us to do some great sight seeing on our own!

Ok, my first time at a Four Seasons. Of course, it was excellent. Staff was incredibly friendly. And of course it was way overpriced. In-room dining was crazy expensive, but you know that when you go. I would say that the food was delicious, the accommodations were excellent, and the location is perfect. Hidden gem: they do free shoe-shines overnight. Look for the bag and instructions in your room.Everything about the place was wonderful. Highly recommend it.

Two night stay in a junior suite to take in Broadway shows. The location is very good: on the edge of central park and a 15 minute walk to the chaos of Times square. Shopping is good and there were plenty of dining options. The hotel has mastered the art of service. everyone from housekeeping to doormen to wait staff are cordial, friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are well appointed in the simple/clean lines design. Bathroom was spacious and very functional. I had room service twice for breakfast and once for dinner--food was excellent and delivered hot and on time. Had a nice evening after show drink at the Ty Bar. Craig, the manager, was very helpful and guided us through the many bourbons on their menu.This hotel attracts very, very wealthy folks (I saw 2 Amex Black Cards waiting on line for check in). Unlike a typical five star hotel in LA where staff fawn over and shamelessly cow tow to celebrity but ignore ordinary folks, this hotel treats everyone like they are royalty or private jet billionaires. I never felt out of place. It is a hotel that has mastered quiet competence and service. It's expensive, but worth the splurge.

Stayed here for five nights in a corner park view suite (not sure the actual name of the suite) and the stay was fabulous. The staff is so professional and had everything covered. The hotel room was full of every amenity and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. Only weird thing about the room was the light fixtures were confusing on how to turn off / on, but that was my only gripe. The room was extremely quite - felt like no one else was in the hotel. Great location, fabulous doormen and overall just a great stay here.

I brought my daughter here for short break, and it was amazing! Staff are out of this world, so polite and helpful. We were truly pampered from the time we arrived to when we left. The front desk and concierge are unparalleled to any staff I have dealt with anywhere in this country, or London. The cleaning staff kept the place spotless!!! And Henry at the bar is a gem! Definitely will return. A. And M. Kandis

The Four Seasons New York was amazing. The service we received from the staff was impeccable—over the top. And that includes assistance from the Concierge prior to our arrival. The room was spacious and clean. The hotel is luxurious and the service outstanding. .

This was our first time staying at the Four Seasons in NY.From the moment you walk in the door you are greeted and made to feel at home.Rooms and bathrooms are spacious. Beds comfy.Great location. Superior staff.

It's the Four Seasons, so expectations are high. Generally it delivers. The service is really spectacular. People are remarkably attentive, thoughtful and make every effort to make guests comfortable. The one letdown is the rooms. They're a bit tired. Nice, clean, well appointed, but beige and tired.

I always stay at the Four Seasons while in New York. Since the hotel was renovated, the rooms are great. The location on 57th street enables you to walk to so many places. I feel like I'm in the middle of all of the action.

Stayed here for a couple of days while speaking at a corporate event. Terrific rooms (bedroom and conference room) and service. Breakfast was superb. In a good location for getting out for a walk and nice restaurants. Need to do a few more corporate gigs to pay for a private trip!

Sonia, Sonia, Sonia! Best front desk person ever. We booked a 36th floor room for the last three nights of our NYC visit literally off the street, having left those open for a change of neighborhood from the fun and bustling Hell's Kitchen.Gorgeously appointed room with everything you need, including the best walk-in closet ever. Splendid Bulgari toiletries (twice the size of what you get at the Cipriani). Great bed and wonderful towels.An incredibly comfortable stay. We'll be back as soon as possible.

While I like to stay a little more West, the hotel is in a prime location for upscale shopping or walking to Central Park.The staff was very nice and professional. The hotel is clean and modern.The bathrooms are all marble, separate tub and shower. I did miss a double sink. My husband and I do not share well.The rooms are a good size.Be prepared to spend money if you want to eat in the hotel.I did try the $46 hamburger...to be fair it had cheese on it.

I absolutely love the Four Seasons. And this location doesn’t disappoint. From the moment you walk up to the desk to check in to the moment the door is opened for you to leave the service is stellar. Think of how you’d feel if you were a member of the royal family and then multiply it by 10. I have stayed at the four seasons for the last 20 years. Probably over 100 times and I have never once had the slightest disappointment. And trust me folks that I’m not loaded. Do whatever you have to do to stay at this hotel when you come to New York! Sell your china, drive for Uber or rob a bank. Trust me....they are that good!!!!!

Great stay and the team at the Four Seasons was amazing! No issues during our week long stay on the property. They were very helpful during our stay. Ed the door man was awesome. He made my wife and I feel right at home.

Absolutely beautiful hotel, service and the fine dining is out of this world. Rooms are splendid and attention to detail is impeccable. Amazing views of the city and in the heart of manhattan. Try the fine dining and you will not eat anywhere else, has the best seafood selection. Open fire is a great place to be while the snow is falling and the music is playing.

Stunning Hotel to spend Christmas Day and New Year Room wasn’t as spacious as I’d thought it would be but I had just been to Las Vegas. Staff were amazing as my husband who never gets sick got sick. Their care and getting a Dr and medication was insurmountable. Thank you for taking such good care of us

Service as expected- Fantastic. We were treated to an extremely personal experience. it seemed like everyone knew our names! In room service was prompt and the front desk/concierge staff extremely helpful.

Extra ordinary stay, hospitable staff, concierge TOP, yummiest breakfast and indeed the best cocktails Luxarious stay If you are looking for an outstanding stay book thereAnd enjoy the lavish experience of the four seasons hotels

This used to be my favourite hotel of choice in NYC for the past 10 years. The location is the best location you can find in Mid Town, the service is impeccable, the staff are amazing, and the room size and furniture is great. Great room service, and great attention to details. The above has mostly not changed, however, since the hotel changed ownership a year or two ago, the room categories has now changed, and the new policy is to call every room category now a "suite". this has led the hotel to increase their rates on pretty much identical rooms, and not be able to offer their regulars simple preferences such as high floor or balcony/terrace. I used to always get the same room with a balcony, but now have been told that this is a higher category (although the same size if not smaller than a normal room). I think this is unfair, and somewhat greedy, and in a way has changed my whole experience to what used to be the finest hotel in NYC. I would still recommend this hotel for its location, its great service and staff, but definitely no longer for their personalization of the experience, nor is it the same value for money it used to be.

I travel regularly to New York (about 80 days a year) and have started to make the Four Seasons my hotel of choice above the Pierre and Loews recency (both of which are good hotels). The lobby is amazing with stunning indoor trees. The rooms are spacious, quiet and have comfy beds. The facilities are good with a decent gym and sauna area. The staff are the standout and Tina at the concierge is an absolute gem. She really knows her theatre (not just the Broadway, but the off and off Broadway as well), and gives very good restaurant recommendations.

All rooms are large, newer and spacious. Stayed in room 1508 which had a nice view. The hotel is an easy walk to Broadway & Central Park. Close to Bloomingales and Bergdorf for those who want to shop.

3 days business in NY can be exhausting. The Four Seasons is the perfect respite to refresh and relax in contrast to working and visiting NYC.The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and spacious for NY.Breakfast was great and fuelled for the day ahead. We had torrential thunder storms and the concierge were on hand with umbrellas to save the day. A hearty welcome back by name was a reminder of how you feel cared for at the Four Seasons.I look forward to returning in the future.

Fantastic service with incredible attention to detail, my favourite meal here is breakfast, what a treat!Location is also a big plus, for a long weekend in New York this is the place to stay, located close to Central Park and within easy walking distance to Broadway shows.

My daughters and granddaughter spent a wonderful four days celebrating two birthdays at the Four Seasons. The public areas and rooms were beautiful, but probably most important, the staff throughout the hotel were wonderful, from the front desk and concierge to the doorman, restaurant, and spa. I highly recommend this hotel for a place to

We always look forward to coming back - the staff is simply outstanding - each and everyone - from the time we arrive up until the time we sadly have to leave. The doormen are all fantastic, front desk/concierge are so kind, bell service - thank you Joe, room service, housekeeping, The Garden - we love Milton, Ty Bar - shout out to Gabrielle for taking good care of us - overall, the Four Seasons is our happy place!

Great Location, Spacious room and very clean. Everything was good except the check in time. We went only at 4.30 or so in the evening and room was still not ready. Other than that, the whole stay was comfortable and nice

Everything here is perfect. The hotel, the guest rooms, the location and the service. It's luxury at it's finest. The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms are beautiful. Everyone is eager to help. And of course, the locations is very convenient.

The hotel team went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our visit. At every touch point, the hotel team were smiling and able to assist at all levels. Everyone was gracious and accommodating and a must visit if you are in NYC!

I've stayed at this Four Seasons before, when I was upgraded to a fantastic room. This time I didn't get the same room but like before, the accommodations were exactly what one would expect from a luxury hotel. The room was spacious, had great views and the bathroom was spectacular. Water pressure, something I find important in any hotel stay, was excellent, I only could complain a bit about the less than intuitive lighting controls, but aside from that it was a very nice stay.

Very nice Hotel < excellent service, Friendly staff.The pricing/value for money in the restaurant is not great, Good Food , very expensive. Atmosphere is just Average.One suggestion for rooms would be a Nespresso coffee machine for early morning quick coffee

I would recommend this hotel if traveling on business. It is not ideal for children - the only working elevator to the lobby is very old and slow. Accessibility with strollers is definitely not ideal. The sleep quality could also be better. The mattress seemed on the harder side than all the other four seasons we have stayed in. Staff was excellent and very clean rooms.

I love staying at the Four Seasons in New York. I don't know how they keep it so quiet, but I have no problem sleeping with wonderful beds and bedding. The food and service are also exceptional. Gorgeous property.

Fantastic hotel with genuine attempt to personalize service. Generous bedroom with seating area, excellent bath and dressing area. Terrific staff with every effort to provide great service. Restaurant staff was also very good and brunch was excellent.

FSNY is a fantastic property with a great location. Easy access to broadway, shopping and food. As soon as you walk through the front door you're transported out of the city and into an escape. The rooms have great views of the streets below, and room service doesn't miss a beat. No matter your reason for stay, the Four Seasons will make it a comfortable one. Special thanks to WhataHotel for securing upgrades and some awesome amenities!

We just spent the weekend in NYC, great location, nice renovated rooms. For $1300 a night, unfortunately, you do not get water at turn down service, unless you ask for it and when I did they ask the lady who brought the towels, she said .... what ? Water ? ... they do not have a nespresso machine, or any type of coffee machine in the room, which is fine if it does not take you 45 mins and a second phone call to get coffee sent to the room. That being said, the staff at the restaurant The Garden was very very nice. I will. It be staying here again. I love Fourseasons we just stayed at their Cairo location ! 5 star

Loved staying here! The staff are amazing and the hotel is super nice. Our room was massive and had the coolest view of the city. It was very central to Many things and we will definitely be returning here next visit!

Stayed at the NYC Four Seasons over spring break and had a wonderful experience. The concierge service was best I have ever experienced and made the trip easier since this was our fist visit to city. Service and facilities were excellent!

Outstanding service. The spa is beautiful and the brunch one of the best in NYC. We stayed for a weekend and the concierge assisted us with prom shopping, museum visits, car services and outstanding food choices...Cafeteria, the Black Tap and dinner at Fun Artsy places. Makes sure you ask a for a terrace room for that extra sights of NYC .

Stayed here for the second time in a few months on a business trip. Was just as good the second time as the first. As you would expect, the rooms are well appointed and the service from the staff is unequaled. I had several special requests that the staff filled immediately ( note: there are no irons or ironing boards in the rooms, so you have to request one). I did not use the fitness facility, nor did I go to any of the restaurants there, but the location provides great options for places to eat and shop if that is your interest.

I had the pleasure of staying three nights for work earlier this month. The staff is professional, friendly and helpful. We had snow and rain one day which kept me indoors most of the day and the room service staff was excellent. The rooms are spacious, clean and updated. The only problem I encountered was the steak house across the street which turns into a night club in the evening can cause noise and car traffic. I was woken up at 2 a.m. one night with cars - assuming Ubers and Taxi - honking and people talking loudly. Heard it all 11 Floors up.

You always expect the best from Four Seasons and the Four Seasons New York (57th Street at Park Avenue) delivers superbly! Everything was perfect. We could not ask for a better place to stay when visiting Manhattan.
