review_body: Booked this hotel for a work trip. They are accommodating and the staff is beyond friendly.Ordered breakfast to the room, and when they brought the wrong items they were quick to fix it for us knowing we were in a pinch to get to work.There was also a huge snow storm coming in the city, and we decided to check out a day early. they were kind enough not to charge us for the extra day that we had booked. That is true service and how you get return guests.Rooms are always impeccably clean, and the bar is a great spot to get a drink.Looking forward to my next trip to NYC to stay right here.

The Four Seasons on 57th is one of the best destinations to stay for business or pleasure in New York City. I cannot say enough about the staff and the amenities of this wonderful property. Be sure to check out the new spa!

This is the best place to stay in New York City by far. The service is excellent, the location can't get better, the staff are always extremely nice and helpful, the food and breakfast can't be beat! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody going to New York.

Outstanding hotel. Hard to find any faults other than slightly expensive with no deals to be found. Location is excellent for shops, restaurants and Central Park.We had a very enjoyable stay and felt the staff went out of thier way to make us feel special.

I recently stayed there for the first time. The location is perfect, and within walking distance from everything in midtown. Rooms recently got renovated, and look very nice and bright. The gym is inferiorly locates in the basement, and relatively small to a hotel of this size. It could get really crowded. Service is exceptional four seasons standard, but the food, relative to other four seasons hotels, is not as exceptional.

Just the classic Four Seasons experience. Impeccable, personalized service, recognized by staff from the moment I arrived. Flawless arrangements by the concierge (e.g., car service), customized service by housekeeping (e.g., stocking the in-room refrigerator with my preferred products), beautiful, spacious suite, high end technology throughout. Simply everything one would expect from a luxury hotel, with a clear effort to exceed those expectations.

Four seasons New York is a beautiful hotel with relaxing recently renovated rooms. However, what sets this hotel apart is its outstanding staff. I have a wonderful experience each time I am a guest at Four Seasons New York.

Had an amazing experience at this property!! We went for a girls weekend and front desk and concierge staff were so friendly and accommodating. They gave us a wonderful room upgrade with a fabulous bathroom and closet area. Only thing I would say negative would be the pricing of the spa services. A little crazy even for New York City prices.

This is an excellent Hotel with great service. Virtually everything is top-notch. Nice room and amenities. Good experience with room service, TY bar and brunch. Staff is great. Only issue was very long delay with retrieving our car from overnight valet parking at a $70 charge. On a quiet Sunday afternoon, should not have to wait 30 minutes for your car to arrive. Good thing the doorman was charming.

We have stayed at this hotel over 10 times and the service and location always keep us coming back. The price is high relative to other high end New York hotels. They are able to charge what they charge because of the over the top level of service they provide.

Recently stayed at FS mid town New York. Like all FS properties, the staff were friendly, efficient and genuinely happy to help with anything needed. The room was beautiful, spacious and immaculate in every way. Great view towards Central Park & 5th Avenue. The building is amazing and the position perfect for business or pleasure. Thanks for making my stay in NY so enjoyable.

Great stay. Kindeness , professionalism off all the Staff. Suite with l'argento terrace. High quality breakfast a la carte . Great room service. Absolute cleening of the room and the bathroom. Absolutely reccomendable Hotel in the center of Manhattam.

Second time staying here.Location: Perfect for me. Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square for theatres. Even walked down to Bryant Park which is only 30 mins away. Rooms: Bigger than the usual NYC hotels. Higher floors give you amazing views - can even see Empire State Building clearly.Service: Inconsistent as compared to other FS properties. Not the personalised service that the FS brand excels at. Consistently slamming doors shut whenever housekeeping goes in and out of every room was a bit annoying when you're trying to nap (or even still asleep in the morning). That said, staff at the bar/lounge on NYE were great. I was going out for the evening (and it was frigidly cold out) - stopped by at the lounge and asked if they could make some hot chocolate for me to take out. I noticed they were busy with NYE customers and the lounge was in full swing. But they attended to it without any hesitation and came back within a couple of minutes. Thumbs up!Will I stay here again? Not sure. For location and room: Yes. For service: Meh.

There is a warmth and sense of relaxed comfort that greets you every time you enter this hotel. You just feel at home. The staff are all just like friends but slightly less familiar, each in turn glad to see you. Their air is always that everything is 'just so', and it invariably is. In my case it certainly was and my expectations were exceeded even at this level.

The best hotel in 5th Ave as Bergdorf Goodman and other branded luxury boutiques are just a stone throw away. Our view facing the most tallest apartment Park Avenue is majestic.We had a chance complimentary ride within the area. It’s in Rolls Royce! Our anniversary holiday was perfect!

We have been coming to NY at Christmas time for the past few years and celebrate my daughters birthday. As the years have went on, the prices have increased substantially with the room size/quality decreasing. Our shower was moldy and room was not turned down one night. At the restaurant we were served someone else's food before receiving ours which was also not what we had ordered. In previous years upon check in they offer the kids a stuffed animal from the little shop, this year they didn't.... this is something children remember and look forward to. All our other stays have sent a little something to the room since we had children with us, this time nothing. Same with my daughters birthday, we always get a cake and this year nothing. This is the most money we have paid of all the years we have been staying at FS and I feel like it was the worst experience we have ever had at any FS. Very disappointing as it has been something we have made a ritual and my daughter looks forward to, to celebrate her birthday. Unfortunately this may have been our last stay.

Most beautiful hotel in NYC with amazing location and fantastic rooms. Staff is friendly and remembers your name every time. Rooms are gorgeous with high ceilings, something you rarely see in Manhattan.

Simply stated, a fantastic hotel with all the right ingredients for a terrific experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff was fully attentive. The room was absolutely marvelous and the view of NYC added to there total pleasure of our stay. I bought my daughter and son-in-law a night at the hotel for Christmas. Overall, amazingly satisfied.

The great staff here is just another reason to return every year. The Concierge staff are quite helpful. They are all good, Rodman has always been especially helpful. It is like staying in a boutique Hotel although it is much more than that. Wonderful Bar as well.

Everyone at the Four Seasons Mid-Town is committed to total guest satisfaction. There is always the " . . . is there anything else I can assist you with to make your stay more enjoyable?" The Garden Restaurant is lovely and has great food. The renovated rooms are nicely appointed: contemporary and comfortable.

We typically stay at The Plaza for our girls trips, but there were no rooms left so we tried the 4 seasons. We loved it. I would definitely go back. Great restaurant, great bar, rooms are perfectly set up and newly renovated.

The Hotel is in an excellent location and there are 2 entrances one on E57th and one on E58th. The Staff are welcoming. The room is really comfortable with a carpeted floor and comfortable chairs and bed. The curtains and blind are all electronically operatedThe lighting is excellent and you can have a very bright light or dim it from a switch next to the bed. Wifi works well and once logged in lasts for duration of stay..They need someone to go over the room amenities when you arrive instead of just bringing up the luggage. . The TV is a beautiful curved TV and one can also access Radio from different Countries. There is no foreign News however so one is restricted to CNN ,Fox and other channels that are in the USA. The room is very clean and the housekeeping is good. I enjoyed my stay.

Very friendly staff.Courteous waiters in the lounge and restaurant (breakfast) . Front desk help was very good.I wish there were staff at the entrance, difficult to find the checkin counter. I would at this hotel again.

From a personalized welcome upon check in to a stylized app making it easy to request anything needed this was such a fantastic experience. Rooms are of good size and kept up to date, the food was excellent, and the bar a quaint place to sit and relax after a busy day.

The newly remodeled property is wonderful, the rooms are well appointed with special attention to detail. The staff is attentive, the concierge went above and beyond to ensure special requests were fulfilled. A joy to stay there!

Always enjoy my stay at this Hotel. The service, overall condition and location of the Hotel couldn't be better. Breakfast and lunch are perfection and the bar/lounge area is a great spot for late night and after theatre wind down.

The hotel upgraded me to the the Warner suite. Although I still miss the many years at the Pierre, this hotel and staff are hard to beat. The suite had to be 3000 sq feet. Great location, Wi-Fi, food, staff. I could not find fault if I tried.Thank you Four Seasons

Having stayed at a number of Four Seasons in recent years a trip to the upgraded Manhattan hotel was eagerly anticipated. After all, what’s not to love about the Four Seasons? However, in spite of some very beautiful Christmas decorations, the building itself was stark and appeared cold. Okay, it is never going to be able to compete with The Four Seasons in Florence or Budapest, but this was pure corporate land.The rooms were bland and lacked any warmth; beige, beige and more beige, no flowers, fruit, or tea and coffee making facilities. No bed dress down service, no chocolate, nothing. Even the toiletries were rationed out as if there was a shortage. The beds and the bed linen were, however, fabulous. Ditto the water pressure in the showers.The food at breakfast couldn’t be faulted either; but again, no extras, no buffet and just a single course with a cup of coffee for two produced a bill that was $130+.The bar was lively and always full but very few bar snacks worth having so in the evenings we were reduced to looking for elsewhere to eat when in fact, after a day trawling through New York streets sightseeing, we were ready for an early night in the hotel.The staff were excellent and couldn't be faulted.All in all, a disappointment. This is a hotel for corporate entertaining which lacks any warmth or finer touches which, for this traveller, can make a stay so enjoyable. In reality, I suspect the hotel does not want to cater for non-business guests.

Luxury hotel in the heart of New York, comfortable and quiet. Concierge perfect in assistance, service in bar and restaurant was good, common areas are not too wide, sometime you would like to have more areas for meetings, SPA very nice experience

The staff was genuinely interested in my experience. Beautiful property and you cannot beat the location for business in midtown. The little touches such as remembering a guest's name from the previous evening demonstrates an attention to detail you find at very few properties.

I felt very comfortable at the hotel. My room was great from the bed, bathroom, TV, and curtains.The hotel staff was very welcoming; easy check-in and check-out.Great location.My highest recommendation.

review_body: I have stayed in many hotels throughout New York City and this is by far the best hotel in the City. It is absolutely beautiful and the rooms are so spacious. It felt brand new and modern yet still had that New York charm and tradition. The staff were all extremely friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Love staying in the FS Hotel in NYC specially during the holidays.The staff were all friendly, courteous, and discrete. The hotel lobby, bar, and lounge were beautiful and welcoming. The suite in which I stayed, had spectacular amazing views. I will look forward to many returns at this particular Four Seasons Hotel, New York...

I have never ever experienced a 5 Star Hotel not giving ANY amenities at all! A few of below amenities should be Standard for a Hotel aiming to offer Extraordinary Experiences, (In European Luxury Hotels you normally find in your Suite a Welcome Card signed from Management, fresh flowers, a basket of fruits, a bedtime treat, a Coffeemaker and at least complementary water and one or two Magazines covering the Point of Interests in the Area of your stay. We could not even find a little sewing kit...Sometime you might even receive a welcome gift (Sparkling Wine) and a Farewell gift.Sadly .......None of the above was available in our Gotham Junior Suite with Terrace.

Staff was incompetent and didn’t care. No hot water in room. Staff took my car for a joy ride. Manager offered to buy me a drink when room was 2k a night. Ive been using 4 seasons for 30 years never experienced anything like this. Many other. Hotels ill use in future

It was a perfect stay starting with the allure of the Christmas season complimented by the Four Season's decorations, to the well appointed accommodations, location in the middle of Manhattan, spectacular food & beverage and especially the service. I have never been so well taken care of and in a friendly and happy to serve manner. Truly top notch....

Great service very friendly staff. The lack of a restaurant for dinner is a disadvantage. The service of the in room dining was great. The bar is very nice. We missed a Nespresso machine in the room, something very common these days.

I stayed again at the Four Seasons: the first time after the refurbishment. The staff welcome was good, and the way the staff manage to recognise guests is really impressive. I had a large room on the 9th floor, and a spa treatment. The room was a great size, but really rather like a small aircraft hanger: it felt empty and unwelcoming (and was very cold for a bit until i got the heating to crank up). Long bare walls, endless versions of beige/cream. Cheap looking sofa. all a bit bleak. No coffee machine, no mineral water (and i don't think any fruit, either ,but may be wrong). . I contrast the Four Seasons in Florence, where I'm currently staying, which manages to be generous and charming (and provides coffee machine and mineral water, and lots of fruit). Interestingly enough I arrived for a few days after a short stay in an upmarket Airbnb - which was a much better place to be. The spa was disappointing too: small and cramped. Lots of coffee/water variants on offer, but no cups/glasses. Expensive (pleasant) massage, to which I added a gratuity - but not at all sure what the additional service charge was for? All in all, quite disappointing.

The Four Seasons Hotel in New York is simply the most special place to stay in New York; elegant, yet not pompous, it's staff, most of whom have been around since it's opening, are fully committed to making a guest feel special. There's a reason that, year after year, the same friendly faces are there to greet you. I can't wait to revisit it again on my next New York trip.

One of the finest hotels that we have ever had the pleasure to stay with. Convenient location, attention to detail and fantastic customer service! The staff goes out of their way to remember your name and to accommodate in any way possible.

This is an excellent, predictable option for mid-town in NYC, with characteristic clean modern design in all rooms, efficient staff, good views, fast elevators, and many amenities (free shoe shine). The lobby is spacious if slightly impersonal, and an annoyingly repeating "Charlie Brown Christmas" track in the high-ceilinged bar. The claim that some rooms have "park view" is somewhat exaggerated.

The hotel and staff were excellent, as always. My wife and I were extremely pleased with our stay. We look forward to seeing you again soon. The bar and service staff are of particular note and highest level.

In general i am a huge fan of Four Seasons but I was highly disappointed ny the Four Seasons NYC. I stayed for 1 night in the hotel and stayed in a Studio 57. it was sold to me as recently renovated. The bathroom had moisture and mold in the shower. In general the room did not really look renovated. I was also missing the classic Four Seasons linen on the bed. The Fitness Center I used in the morning at 5am is ok’ish but nothing special rather an old underground facility. The negative highlight was breakfast. 15 USD for a bad cappuccino and 23 USD for a yoghurt! Incredible expensive and really nothing special. All in all an uneventful and disappointing stay.

Very nice hotel that lives up to the brand name. Great staff. Very helpful. I enjoyed the bar with friends and family and would definitely stay there again. Loved that they had some marathon supplies ready very earlier in the morning for the runners.

Just recently came from NY and stayed at the Four Season. Rooms have been updated so I was happy. Rodman at the concierge desk helped with some items I had shipped home. He also gave some great restaurants recommendations. Bar at the Four seasons makes a great Lemon Drop martini and I was happy with the bar menu. Many choices. I think this is a great location. Central Park is only a few blocks away, and tons of shopping!!! I always feel safe in this area of town. The restaurant TAO is next-door to hotel. Food is great.

Usually the Four Seasons is exceptional, this time it fell a bit short. There were several issues with the bathroom which they did proceed to fix...more or less. The staff was wonderful as always. I just feel when you are paying these prices things should be top notch??!

This was our first time at a Four Seasons Hotel and we were not disappointed. We had a "Park Avenue Suite" on the 47th floor overlooking the entire city of New York, the Hudson and East Rivers. The view was spectacular - so much so that we had several meals in our room. The hotel is centrally located and the staff are very friendly. My only reason for 4 stars is "no coffee" available to make in the room. We did have room service every morning but it would have been nice to make a cup first thing in the morning. That is a convenience we truly enjoy. Other than that "minor" inconvenience our stay was what we had hoped for.

Ordered some items on Amozon.com, items 'delivered'on 23rd October, I was in the Hotel from 26 to 29 October 2017 and they were not able to track the package....Besides a lousy Concierge, the service at the Restaurant and Lobby Bar is far too slow, and the quality of the cleaning service in the room is not up to FS.In brief, a total waste of money. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE IN NYC.

My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons in NY for a week at the end of September and our close friends joined us 3 days later.Thank you for making us feel like royalty every single day. Nothing was too much trouble, everyone was genuinely friendly, helpful and happy. Everything was perfection. Randy and Analiza on concierge, Ann in the gym all made us feel very welcome and were very accommodating of my personal circumstances.The location of the property was great with access to local restaurants and bars as well as shops with a short walk to Central Park. An amazing experience. Thank you for such a fabulous stay.

Now this girl is not cheap but it is truly well run. They are attentive to details and the service is really great. I particularly liked the concierge there and also the size and the comfort of the room. If I'd change anything then the F&B a little and I'll try if I can make the rooms more quite which I know is not easy. Will be back.

Had only a short afternoon free on a one-day visit. Passing by the concierge desk I asked for directions to walk and see the Hudson Yards construction project; not only was the concierge familiar with the project, but quickly offered advice on the best route, and how to view the project most effectively. Couldn't have been better.

Excellent service, location and amenities. Highly recommend to other travelers. Be sure to arrange all activities through Concierge including show tickets, restaurants, activities and car service. Will be back again next year.

We had original booked London NYC. Unfortunately they didn't Honor our original booking and gave us a substandard filthy (stain full room). We after 4 hours of dealin with poor management checked out of the London NYC to come to the Four Seasons. That is when we started to be treated like humans and not another reservation number. Thank you to the excellent teams at the Four Seasons NYC. This team included the registration staff, concierge, the bellmen, the housekeeping and the restaurant. You guys saved our trip! Thank you.

On entering the lobby, this hotel seems every bit like the five-star hotel the brand is known for. The staff at the front door met us warmly (the same could not be said of one of the front desk staff) and the lobby looked grand.However, once you step into your room, it is like stepping into a budget hotel. To give it credit, the room was huge by NYC standards, but the room was unbelievably sparse and cheaply furnished - it felt like one had stepped into Comfort Suites. The only thing nice was the big plasma TV.There was a tasteless cheap sofa and just two magazines - not even a Time Out or similar kind of publication for things to do. And we were actually in a junior suite.There was no kettle, no coffee machine, no bottled water. For the price of their rooms, this is surely not too much to ask for. I asked for an iron and ironing board when I checked in and it only arrived 90 mins later - after about 5 phone calls frantically chasing for it as I was late for an appointment. I walk into my bathroom to find used toiletries. After complaining, I was replenished with two bigger bottles that also looked a fifth used! The same thing happened with my other travel companions in their respective rooms. The more we brought this up with them, the more bottles arrived - but always with some that weren't full. Another travel companion had green water coming out of the pipes when she tried to fill her bath. We also tried the spa, which had one tiny shower and not much facilities working. The jacuzzi was empty. When I tried to give the therapist a tip, I was told they had no change and I had to go to the reception to get my own change - not the service standards I expect from a Four Seasons!When I mentioned the problems at check out, the front desk staff took note and said they would get back to me. It's been several days now, not even an email of apology.Obviously they do not pride themselves on their service standards at this Four Seasons. For the kind of rates they are charging, there certainly would be plenty of better options in NYC.

Staffs were extremely polite and friendly Always ready to help I called for extre tea bags and milk Within a minute they brought everything with a smile The rooms and bathroom were so neat and extremely spacious Nice hotel

Celebrated our 35th Anniversary at the Four Seasons Mid-town and had a wonderful experience from the moment we entered until we left 4 days later. We were surprised with a room upgrade and wonder champagne and chocolates. Although a pricey hotel (more than most), we will go back because we felt it was exceptional in many regards.

Excellent location right in the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Warm reception from the door. Excellent guest relations. Beautiful views from our comfortable, bright and airy suite. We enjoyed ending our busy days at the bar. The mood and soft lighting just did it.

You just can't beat the Four Seasons. The service is always top notch, the room was immaculate. If it wasn't for the price it would be all 5 for me. But I must say it's the Seasons so we got what we paid for. It will always be our first choice.

Excellent hotel with large rooms that were recently remodeled and updated. Hotel has the perfect location and offers great service with all the amenities. We could not ask for a better stay. I highly recommend this hotel!

AWESOME JOURNEY One of the best moments of my life unbelievable many thanks to all the employees of this wonderful hotel everything was perfect the reputation of this hotel was right even the pancakes at breakfast !

We were looking forward to our stay at the four seasons in New York.  We were there to celebrate our anniversary in addition I've been going through some medical challenges so this was going to be a lovely retreat of the weekend. It was completely ruined by the hardness of their mattresses. The staff did try to help but we later found out as we were checking out that they could've changed out the mattress though there seems to be a serious lack of communication between the different teams at the four seasons New York . We have stayed at other four seasons and never had this issue .

The staff the rooms the service is unique. Ask to Clancy the concierge what’s the hottest spots in the city. The whole time they make you feel you’re in home also is always clean gym and spa a must so far I’ll be back soon ...

My wife and I recently celebrated our 10 year anniversary - the concierge team handled it all from beginning to end (made awesome recommendations, got last minute reservations when we changed plans, etc. etc.). Our trip was stress free and fantastic because of them.

Nice location, nice rooms, nice amenities, strong service, averithing is there to have a good stay, both for business or leisureOnly negative point: if you want internet to see videos, is a $25 per day.

Had an espresso in the lounge it was afternoon time ..the pillars of the hotel passing from the lobby combines the elegance of past and the modern charisma of the present time. The staff are very responsive....ofcourse it is four seasons has to be...been to the Four Seasons in Riyadh ..DIFC in Dubai as well as in Bahrain ...and the image this brand carries lasts in each one of its property...Had a great afternoon thank you....

Perfect way to unwind! We were greeted by the most professional desk staff, our room was mint condition like no one else had ever stayed there befor. The Sauna and men's lounge where and unexpected win!

The view on Central Park was stunning, service is exceptionnal. Finding such a child-friendly place helped a lot making our honeymoon special: small gift for ou 2.5 years old child at the arrival, a stroller waiting for us for the duration of our stay, a lot of help to manage our baby-sitting needs... All in all, beyond our expectations!

Great Hotel and staff,Very professional and detailed. From the moment we arrived staff from counter takes up to room and makes sure everything is to your liken. I had several special requests as a surprise and everything was setup better than I could have expected. Well worth the money.

This hotel is a calm oasis in a bustling city. The lobby is serene. The room was immaculate and Four Seasons always has the best service. The staff is friendly at check in and greets you every time they see you. I asked for a Nespresso machine in the room and of course they delivered promptly. Housekeeping brought bath salts as soon as I asked. Lovely to have a separate soaking tub. You can't go wrong here.

You can never be let down by Four Seasons! My favourite brand and they don't fail to impress! We went with our 4 kids and they had personalised gifts for each of them! The little touches makes all the difference!

The quality of customer service at this hotel was beyond superb. Anything we asked for was granted, with a smile, incredibly polite and efficient. It didn't matter which aspect of staff we were dealing with, they were all incredibly kind, warm and beyond accommodating. The hotel was quiet, elegant and efficient in all areas. I'm pretty sure the word "no" doesn't exist at this Four Seasons. The gentlemen who represent the valet staff are smart, courteous and on the spot whenever you need them. They went above and beyond their job description. Thank you for a wonderful week!

We were at the Four Seasons in August. Perfect location. Excellent service across everything, from the very moment you are picked up at the airport up to the room. The restaurant and the room service can prepare unforgettable tasting experiences (and we are Italian!). The Concierge team was extremely knowledgeable about the city and beyond. They helpes me and my son to arrange trips to other location with outstanding professionalism but also great human touch and kindness. It was my son's first trip to the US and the Four Seasons team helped me to make it really memorable. Our warm thank you to the entire team and in particular to Tina and Rodman from the Concierge desk (ciao from Pier!) ! We will come back next year for sure! Rita&Pier

Great location fantastic service. The concierge desk was extremely knowledgeable and helpful.Highly recommended. One of the best in New York, definitely coming back!The personal attention and friendly service is really unique

We had a five night stay here in August 2017 (room 2101). The hotel is well located on the upper east side, a short walk from central park. The lobby is imposing, with a bar to one side and breakfast lounge to the other. The room that we had was large, with a separate sofa and desk area, and generous bathroom. The shower was terrrific, powerful and easy to use, and the mattress was comfortable. A minor quirk is that the duvet has a sheet separation rather than a proper cover. Room lighting was good, there was a vast TV screen and plenty of closet space, as well as lots of easily accessible electrical sockets. The hotel breakfast was excellent albeit breathtakingly expensive, as are any incidentals here: we each had a pot of tea on arrival, and this came to $40 before tip. Staff are very well trained, and we were frequently greeted by name after a day or two here, no mean feat for staff in what is a large hotel. This is easily the best hotel I have stayed at in New York. It is not cheap, but then the best rarely is.

We were so happy to stay in this hotel. Transfer from the airport was very straight forward from the taxi driver that the hotel arranged to collect to us. All the staff we encountered at the hotel were very friendly welcoming and helpful. Our rooms are wonderfully large and bed is very comfortable, very clean, and modern, bathrooms are also large, clean and modern and a large shower with the rainfall shower head. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and boutiques so it was so convenient. This is an excellent choice for a stay in wonderful hotel and I definitely recommend.

Excellent Hotel and service.All personal is over thinkig in your confort and needsThe food in restaurant is excellent, the service is unique.The room is amazing.The doorman resolve me all needs and facilitate mi life.

We stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 nights over New Year's Eve. It was a great stay, our room was massive, airy and kept clean. The bathroom and walk in closet was huge. Who said that hotel rooms in New York were small?!Overall a great stay.

I have stayed at the Four Seasons while in the city on business. Fantastic location and large and comfortable room, well worth the money you pay. Friendly staff, great bar and atmosphere, got to spot a few tennis players and celebrities while sipping my tasty drink. Definitely staying there again.

Very friendly, excellent rooms. We feel well all the time we stay there. Extremly helpfull and friendly are the employes in front of the Hotel, for example: They give us water when we came back from running through the Center park, which is very near to the Hotel.

We love the Four Seasons wherever we go and the NYC mainstay is as exceptional as always. The hotel rooms are renovated and our junior suite was perfect. Capped off the evening at the Ty Bar. A great weekend getaway.

We stayed at the Four Seasons during a family holiday to New York. The location is outstanding - just over a block from Central Park and close to major attractions and shopping. Check in was incredibly quick and easy and the service overall was exceptional. The concierge service was particularly excellent and was very personal. Anything we needed was immediately and effortlessly arranged and their recommendations were spot on. One request for the best route to Battery Park (for the trip to the status of Liberty) yielded a 5 page letter, delivered to us within minutes, provided various detailed transportation options, nearby restaurants and other attractions in the area. We appreciated the fresh fruit in the room (peaches and plums), the sweet treats for our son upon arrival and the spacious room. The only drawbacks in an otherwise faultless stay was the cost of the hotel breakfast and that our suite looked directly into the conference room of the neighbouring office block.

I picked this hotel as it was close to Central Park ,( I have stayed at the Beverly Hills Four Seasons where the staff are faultless ), a must visit in the summer and winter . Lovely room , good size and quiet . Bar - very overpriced sliders and drinks but that is to be expected . I picked to stay here as it was convenient to a location I had booked for dinner, and to meet my son arriving from college . I had a very unacceptable and rude unprofessional experience with the concierge team , still awaiting an apology ! It was a misunderstanding between an inquiry and actual booking , totally a mistake on their part but the mishandling of the situation wasted precious time with my sons . I moved hotels after this experience , to the Langham Hotel 5th Ave wonderful rooms professional curious staff and better central location for Christmas Shopping .

Four Seasons Hotel New York is about as good as it gets anymore in the big apple. All staff are dedicated to making your stay a wonderfully memorable experience. This is top class. Provisions are beyond compare. Lodgings and accommodations are great with brilliant caretaking and concierge.

The Four Seasons in NYC is superb. The staff is the finest and the hotel was renovated in the last year. No complaints whatsoever. Excellent location on 58th Street between Madison and Park as well. Also, the hotel has car that, if available, can drop you off. The workout facility is perfect. I highly recommend the hotel.

We had an amazing stay at the Four Seasons NY hotel last week! Impeccable service, beautiful accommodations and a wonderful concierge. I highly recommend this spectacular property for both personal and business stays.

The Four Seasons Manhattan property is fantastic! The employees are very service oriented and provide the best of service to their guests. The concierges are top notch professionals. The restaurant employees are friendly, provide excellent service and delicious food. The rooms are beautiful and the total property is always in tip top shape. A great experience in the Big Apple.

Hotel is just amazing, but comes at a price, then again you get what you pay for I guess. Superb location, and the twin room was awesome, from the entrance door to the bedroom was like walking another block it was so huge! Loved the fact that the Roller was available to guests even though it had a pretty strict understandable limit to distance, used it once however :)

Excellent location. Friendly staff. Manager Ms.Nagham was supper friendly and made us feel at home. Friendly atmosphere. Despite the bad experience I had with the valet parking. I do recommend this hotel and will come back again.

Best hotel in NYC based on rooms, Service and location. Great rooms and views, especially in North side of building. Great shopping and restaurants nearby. Close to central park. Be sure to hang out in lobby for great people watching.

We are Four Seasons devotees, but this was our first visit to this NYC location. We flew in for the weekend from DFW specifically for my birthday present to see Bette Midler in Hello Dolly. The room and amenities (we have two kids) were excellent as always. However, I must point out the BEST that this hotel has to offer. "Milton" at the Tree Restaurant. We had lunch and breakfast. He was a gem. We brought our two tween daughters and he not only engaged them, but also told them the interpretation of their names from his ethnicity. He got to know us very well in the short time we had at lunch. The next morning at breakfast, he called us each by the correct name and remembered what we were going to do that day. He had the two tables next to ours and obviously was just as endearing with them. He engaged us with the table next to us (they had seen Hello Dolly the day before). What a wonderful person you have! He deserves a promotion and huge bonus. You have an incredible ambassador for your brand. Milton was worth the dining experience alone.

The Four Seasons is the place to stay if you want a sanctuary away from the hubris of the city. Located in the best section of Midtown, the moment you walk through the doors and up the stairs you understand this hotel isn't for just anyone. To the left is the bar/lounge that is so inviting you may not want to leave. To the right is their all day restaurant with waiters there for 24 years or longer just waiting to make your experience the best. Certainly you pay for it but breakfast here truly is a treat.Rooms are newly renovated in the Four Seasons motif. I had a junior suite with enough closet space and drawers to stay a month. You know the bed is fab and one reason to stay here. The only thing missing in the room was complimentary water. Service is as you would expect-anything at anytime. I checked out the spa and fitness center in the lower basement (5 levels below ground level). Fitness center well equipped and spacious. Spa is on the small side. Treatments rooms very small and a bit noisy (I think due to the plumbing in the ceiling) but my massage therapist was in the top 10 percentile (Annie). Overall, Four Seasons is one of the top hotels in NYC and if you want a peaceful scene, this is the place to check out.

Great hotel, excellent service and staff attentions. Rooms renovations is great. Highly recommended. Hopefully bathrooms rev¡novation is done soon. Very friendly environment. Very experience concierge staff.

Impecable service and hotel condition. The best hotel experience in NY either for business or leisure. Concierge extremuly attentious and special gifts to kids. An experience to be remembered. A must place to stay during the whole year.

Four seasons New York is all class it's in a great position , the staff are wonderful in all areas room service staff are extremely professional and friendly as are the cleaning staff this hotel is run smoothly it's a little exy price wise but you get what you pay for and hence your every need is taken care of hope this helps

After staying faithfully at the Four Seasons 57th Street for 20 years and feeling loyalty to many of the great staff that are still there, I just have to say that it isn't what it was or what a Four Seasons is supposed to be. First, the positive: They have at last upgraded the rooms, which are lovely but for three things. One, there is no chair with an ottoman so the only place to put your feet up is to sit on the bed. Two, they have put artificial flowers for n the rooms (and in the restaurant), something I cannot image Isadore Sharp ever allowing. Three, the toilets have never cleared on one flush and they still don't. Another flaw is that the bathrooms have only one sink. That's always been true, but they didn't change it. The other positive is the staff that have been there for years. They are like family, and they know us and take great care of us. The biggest negative for me is Ty's Bar. In the past the main bar was on 58th Street. That was closed maybe two years ago to be turned into banquet space. The old Ty's, which was a great quiet space with a terrific light dinner menu, was heaven. You could actually talk to people there. And you could come in from a late flight and get a great light meal with a great glass of wine. Perfect. The new Ty's Bar was first done with bright red seats and as many chrome with black tops tables as they could cram in. A nightmare. Loud, raucous music. And, a Bites menu, not a light dinner menu. You can't even get a burger. I've noticed that it's mostly empty when I've been there. And I know why. Also, some staff who were great were let go when the change was made. There is no evening option for a meal other than room service. The Garden is still open for breakfast and lunch, and it is still good with the staff I've known so long. I noticed, though, that the cords for the lights on the trees are hanging loose, another thing Isadore Sharp never would have countenanced. And there are artificial flowers in the big arrangements. At a Four Seasons?!?!?! The other thing that grates is the total commercializations of all the spaces. High-end hotels do display the wares of fine shops in the area. But this takes it to a new level. Every space is an ad or a shop. The jewelry shop at the top of the 58th Street entrance has been closed at least since we were there in April. A great painting used to hang there. The handbags on sale in the lobby didn't seem to be there this weekend. The hotel is owned by Ty Warner who made his money on Beanie Babies. I have no animus toward Beanie Babies, but displaying them in the lobby of a Four Seasons just seems way off key. Overall, the place just feels like something is off. I hate to say it because I have loved the place. But, like many things, it has changed. We just checked in to the Four Seasons in Georgetown, and, blissfully, the lobby isn't full of ads. There is art and good taste, and I feel like I'm in a Four Seasons again.

Great location. Fantastic Restaurant. Large room for New York standards. Good service too. Nevertheless, the hotel does not have charm of other four seasons around the world. You are not going to be either disappointed nor excited about your stay

The room renovations are amazing. Beautiful updating of this lovely hotel with rich but soothing fabrics and a very clean line throughout the room. For those who have stayed here in the past you will notice that the bathrooms have remained the same which feels particularly dated given the room refresh, but not a big deal.I wish I could be as enthusiastic about the staff. Unfortunately no refresh here. The Four Seasons New York has always had a staff that was comfortable being indifferent to its guests. You will notice the same now. Yes there are always exceptions. But pay attention to the door staff on their mobile phones who open the door for you 50% of the time because they are too busy with the screens to notice. If you have bags that you don't wish to carry yourself, the door staff will have their hand out when you step out of the taxi and then somebody new will have their hand out when they bring the bags to your room. Same in reverse when you leave. The front desk staff is uneven--some nice, some act like you are inconveniencing them with your request. Is it tolerable? Probably, for the rooms alone, at least once. Can anything be done about the indifferent service? With great effort. New York is not a place that attracts those really interested in serving. One will find similar attitudes at the Loews and the Palace and the Mandarin. The Ritz Central Park and downtown somehow have managed to attract or create staff with a service ethos. When it comes to service you don't get what you pay for at the Four Seasons New York.

We stayed for a quick trip to celebrate our anniversary for two nights and three days. We had also stayed several years ago. The hotel had a major renovation and they did a fantastic job. The hotel was gorgeous, the guest room was excellent and the entire staff was super. Would definitely stay there again. The hotel also has an excellent gym and great spa. Has the best location in the city with some of the finest restaurants within walking distance or short cab ride for the foodies out there namely, Per Se and Daniel.All the top stores are with in walking distance to the hotel as well. I highly recommend this property.

We truly love our stay and fall in love with our room. The view is amazing facing the most expensive apartment and tallest in NYC.We also received a complimentary ride in the Rolls Royce to a store nearby! Indeed luxury at its best!!!!

Amazing concierge service, there is nothing you could want that they can't find! Dinner reservations from a place we went to on our last trip, four years before! Entire staff at your service from the door man to housekeeping and everything in between!

From the moment I arrived, until leaving, I felt as if I was at home. The staff were very personable. The hotel is amazing. Rooms were comfortable,clean and very up to date. The spa and its people were wonderful. I got the best hair cut ever!! The food was so delicious. The concierge staff met our every need. Can not wait to return.

You couldn't ask for more in a hotel: subdued elegance and understated luxury in the best shopping and sightseeing area in the city! Very welcoming staff; amazing chocolate cake, good breakfast, nice lobby bar!

Experience five-star New York hotel living in this modern-deco landmark – like your own personal residence steps from Central Park and Madison Avenue shopping. Enjoy Midtown Manhattan’s exhilarating whirlwind, then return to the serenity and luxury of Four Seasons Hotel New York for breathtaking park and city views.

Get a tall floor, the windows are big and you overlook the city. Bvlgari shampoos and soaps with their unique scent, the bathtub fills up very quickly and is very restful. Concierge is always nice and breakfast is ample. Don't see any reason why I wouldn't recommend this.

For convenience, service and style, the 4 seasons is hard to beat and as a business customer I've enjoyed this hotel on and off for a long time. More recently I've become acclimatised to a more conveniently located, slightly less expensive, 5 star mid town hotel which has a nice friendly and busy vibe, but on my most recent trip this was full for my dates so I was happy to revisit 4 seasons. I have to say, though, I was underwhelmed. Staff friendly, accommodating, and solicitous but the hotel seemed to me to lack a certain warmth. There's been work done to the interior entrance, restaurant and bar. But It feels dark impersonal and foreboding, like a Tim Burton Batman movie. I had to use my iPhone torch to select a glass of wine from the menu. My secretary made a booking via a booking agency, so not directly, and on arrival I distinctly felt treated like a second class citizen in terms of room allocation, being assigned to a perfectly ok room on a lower floor but with no obvious view (one of the pluses of staying at the hotel). Breakfast Menu poorly configured and expensive, gym disappointing. And a last bugbear of mine , 5 star hotels with air conditioning in the summer really should provide plenty of free bottled water as a matter of course. This was grudging. Still a very nice hotel, but not outstanding. An anti-climax. Complacent, It needs to work harder

I've reviewed a number of 5* hotels in NYC and finally, I have found my NYC home. The junior corner suite (Gotham) was light, bright, well equipped and beautifully decorated. (A bit scandi 80s but light bright and clean)What sets the Four Seasons apart is the service. Each member of staff provided exemplary service - efficiently and accurately and politely delivered. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were fabulous value for the quality, the food and beverage is desperately expensive, but you have other options if you set food outside the hotel. Expect no more reviews of NYC 5* hotels until I try out the currently being renovated Waldorf. This place is officially NY home.

review_body: There are few if any properties around the globe and in the USA that match the service that this property and its staff deliver. This is the place to stay if you want to experience the best service in the world!!!

I have always been a big fan of the four seasons hotel in hing kong. Not only am I a member of the spa I also spend most of days there. I naturally have a vey high expectation of the four seasons no matter where they are located. Other words, I planned my New York City summer vacation with my daughter staying in hotel. However, I was beyond disappointed.

We often stay at the Four Seasons. It is a wonderful hotel. The hotel has a remarkable staff. We don't come often enough to matter to them, but they make us feel like we are royalty. (They remember our dogs who haven't seen them in over two years.) We love the modernization they've done. We love the location. Mostly we love the staff and the service.

Great location, walking distance with lots of resteraunts, shops and attractions. The only con would be that the rooms were smaller than expected, but very clean! We would stay again again for our next visit

The staff at this property is so attentive. Extremely professional. Everything was perfect. Even the time I requested my coffee in the morning. The door men recognize you right away. Feels like a better version of home.

The beautiful corner room offered a perfect view uptown and west. Well appointed with a sofa and desk, the accommodation was perfect for breaks between business meetings. The front desk staff, bellmen and front door staff provided every courtesy and assistance to make 3 days in the city productive, comfortable and enjoyable.

Not coming back due to a super low quality of service from the guest relations manager. Michele was by far the most unprofessional hotel services personelle I have ever encountered in my years of travel and luxury hotel stays.

This hotel works hard to make sure that service is their top priority. Each employee is always very friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room was comfortable, beautiful and immaculate. Concierge went the "extra mile" to ensure we enjoyed every aspect of our family vacation in the city!

Exceptional Service! The difference between this hotel and other luxury hotels is the customer service. We didn't have to lift a finger. The best accommodations for us were the valet parking for our car which they let us use for 24 hours even after our check out time and the complimentary Rolls Royce on request for drop off. Definitely recommend.

A magnificent hotel to reside at for a long weekend or for business. Service is impeccable and the rooms are beautiful. Concierge services are superb in arranging for activities and attending to all details. Have traveled the United States and have always stayed at Four Seasons Hotels, but always feel the one in New York City to be at the top of the list.

Highest compliments - this is a standout property run by a staff that truly cares to make your stay wonderfully memorable. My wife and I stayed here for an anniversary. The desk representative Philipp, greeted me as if I were an honored long time guest, and Hotel Manager, Michal Dedera, even stepped out to say hello. We are no-one special, but they sure made us feel as if we were VIPs, including special celebratory amenities when we got to our room. The room is serene. Incredibly comfortable and quiet. Another fantastic stay at Four Seasons!

review_body: Our recent stay at the Four Seasons in NYC was as perfect as it gets. We returned from 2 busy weeks in Europe on business and were quite jet lagged and worn out. This was a great way to rest up. The room was spacious and the service impeccable. I have to mention the Concierges who were so helpful with transportation and in shipping a suitcase home through Luggage Forward. They made everything so easy. Loved the relaxing decor in the room too. It's now my favorite hotel in NYC.

I loved the hotel, it has a perfect location, the new decor it's absolutely beautiful! Love the room space!I did find breakfast a bit expensive but at least it was really good! The service and concierge was great!

He staff and overall hotel experience was terrific. Rooms are phenomenal and the hotel is ideally located. Fitness center is very nice. We also had a very good experience with the meeting facility. Food was outstanding.

I do love staying at Four Seasons Hotels, but this was truly the best experience I have ever received. The woman who took my phone reservation was very kind and answered my questions concerning the location of the hotel relative to the sites I wanted to visit. Additionally, I cannot say enough about Phillip at the registration desk . He went out of his way to make sure we had everything I asked for and more. He couldn't have been nicer. He was extremely gracious and professional my entire stay. Also, Allen the gentlemen who took care of the luggage was very informative and pleasant. The room was very quiet, just remodeled and very clean. The restaurant and bar were a delight. Finally, Walter provided an excellent ride in the hotel Rolls Royce. Thank you all for providing a wonderful stay. I will return to this Four Seasons very soon! T. Mackey

Yes, I went down to get a cappuccino to take back to my room and that was the room charge for the, unfortunately, undrinkable cappuccino. Of course, you are at the flagship property for the Four Seasons, so it may not be entirely unexpected to pay high prices. The best thing about the Four Seasons, New York is, well most everything. The standouts were the service and the interior design of the hotel public areas and the rooms. We were in a Junior Suite priced at $870 per night (not including all of those NYC taxes). I used the gym which was not elaborate, but sufficient -- and the best perk was fresh fruit, tea and chocolate covered almonds in the dressing area.

This was our 6th trip to NYC and the Four Seasons was the nicest place we have stayed there. Most impressive was the quietness of the room, a rare occurrence in NYC. Not cheap but extremely high quality.

Overall trip was very good. Quality of hotel, service, decor and facilities all ideal. AC in room was a slight problem but otherwise all good. Would recommend for your next trip if this is in your oricecrange.

It's a beautiful hotel, but more importantly the service is top notch. We arrived on a red eye, but they had our room ready when we got in so we didn't have to wander around NYC waiting to get in. We were there for our anniversary and they provided us with a bottle of Prosecco and chocolates, and when we didn't get a chance to drink it for a couple of days, sent someone up to the room to refresh the ice so it would be cold. Great experience!

This is an amazing property designed by the master architect and arguably the best location in NYC. The staff is exceptional and food is extraordinary. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and attractive. Super HD TV with great channel selection. You could not find a better hotel in NYC.

This hotel has a great location. Staff and concierge could not have been any more helpful and friendly. Rooms are beautiful and clean. Quiet and walking distance to so many places such as Broadway plays, Central park, the Met, Tiffanys.

review_body: The staff was exceptional. The way they treated our children was by far the best experience we have ever had in our travels. The size of the rooms was amazing for NYC or any where else in the world. Exceptional people, processes, and property. Would definitely visit again!

Great place to stay.I felt that the hotel staff really cared about my well being.Superb room design, with lots of natural light and the right design in colours, It was as if I was at home.Not too crowded as it happen in many NYC "luxury" hotels.

A paragon of civil efficient and well managed property. Newer property downtown In mid town a just off the fifth avenue rush is a classic that has excellent staff, amenities, spa and eateries Price premium allows customers high standards and expectations Been an oasis of calm and attentive service for decades Consistently among best rated luxury hotels in New York

Service and welcome were excellent, the staff were of the highest quality - nothing was too much or too little. I don't know how the Four Seasons do it but they consistently set the standard for others to try and follow. The food was presented well and tasted even better. We are all looking forward to the time when we will return.

Room and Hotel 5 star food and service 1 STAR. I would like a refund. when my hot breakfast is cold, my dinner late, champagne warm it is not what I expect of this caliber. I had an early morning meeting and did not have the time or energy to begin to tell the front desk about my lack of service. the best person was the elevator man who helped with the non-working fob provided by the front desk. Hospitality was not subpar. the entire staff need to be coached.

Even if you don't stay here, just duck in to gape at the monumental IM Pei designed lobby of this midtown jewel. Just for fun, pretend you are Cleopatra meeting Marc Antony here - its not hard to do! A recent remodel fixed the wifi bugs that plagued the hotel and all the rooms have been newly renovated. If you liked the way the rooms were before, as I did, the feeling is the same-- elegant, impeccable sophistication and spaciousness, the ultimate luxury in New York City. Add to this perfect, friendly and nearly instant service and you will soon be forever spoiled. This hotel can't be beat. Equalled perhaps, but never beat. And yes, the bathtub still fills in sixty seconds.

review_body: Okay, let me be honest by telling you I would never pay the price to stay here out of my own pocket. HOWEVER.... due to a very generous client I was put up here for two nights to attend a meeting. I had a penthouse room which was larger than some of the apartments I lived in during my undergraduate days. Extremely clean, amazing views, stellar - I mean STELLAR service, incredibly comfortable. Elegant, chic, felt like a princess. If you can afford it, "just do it"!

Best experience ever.. Everyone professional and friendly.. The rooms were very spacious and elegant. The spa had everything you would want to feel special. Every staff member made a special effort to make sure all needs were taken care of.. But the best part was a surprise birthday cake delivered to our room.. It made her day.

While on a three day trip to the Big Apple, when money is not tight, this is a great place to be pampered by meticulously trained staff and classy accommodations. Would I choose to stay there again? By all means!

After a wonderful business day in New York, the comfortable respite of the Four Seasons was comforting. This property is classy , staffed with great people, with attention to details. If this class of hotel is your choice, it certainly is satisfying. Of course, be sure to use both of the shades, controlled by individual buttons to avoid too much eye contact with people in the offices in neighboring highrise building. !!! Welcome to New York. Philip at the front desk is fabulous.

The Four Seasons does not disappoint. I have stayed at a few of the Four Seasons properties and have always had an exceptional experience; great service, food, accommodations. If you stay at the Four Seasons in NYC be sure to take advantage of the concierge as they can help with theater tickets and dining reservations.

review_body: A one day business trip and at want more. Four Seasons, New York, provides a stunning classy environment to either accomplish business or enjoys he lifestyle offerings in New York. The concierge staff is knowledgement and willing, and I had the pleasure of checking in with Phillip at the front desk who was uber professional and very friendly. Well done. Phillip . The soaps and shampoos are great , I found myself washing my hands more than normal as the soap was so appealing. The bar is beautiful yet be aware that a martini, with regular Smirnoff, costs $30. Better options in the City.

This is the firth or fifth time my wife and I have stayed at the Four Seasons. Recently renovated, the rooms are spacious and quiet. WIFI perfect (didn't work two years ago). Service exactly what one expects from the Four Seasons. If you want eggs Benedict at 4 AM, believe me you'll get it--on the dot. Room service excellent. Hotel restaurant for lunch so so, but the hotel is located within an easy walk to great restaurants. Location for shopping, the park, museums, etc. can't be beat

Lovely hotel and charming staff!The wonderful part is this Four Seasons did not have any "signature scent" throughout their lobby, restaurants, and halls. I am, unfortunately, someone who cannot tolerate fragrances, aftershaves, perfumes, etc. I am so grateful. Thank you for not spoiling my experience.

This hotel is centrally located with walking distances to upscale shopping, fine dinning, and much more. The rooms are spacious, spotless and tastefully decorated. The stuff are very friendly and helpful, the on-site restaurant serves nice food. We had a wonderful stay, will definitely be back.

I stayed at the Four Seasons on 57th street in NYC. It's a great hotel. The rooms are large and classical. There are some glitches like some pipe noise we can hear from other bathrooms. The windows are quite soundproof although you can hear car horns (and they can be often in NY). As usual with Four Seasons, the service is outstanding. We had breakfast at the restaurant. The food was really good but the prices were really high. I mean, $18 for a fresh orange juice is quite something. And that is before taxes and tips. I must add that in NY, it is really hard to find a great hotel that has it all... particurlarly in midtown. So relative to other hotels, the Four Seasons gives you a great room, a good location and a with a level of service unmatched.

The fact is when you're at the four seasons you expect a five-star experience. So that is what we expect the room was beautiful great bathrooms shampoo and soap were pleasantly scented. Housekeeping and cleanliness were first rate. The actual wedding we attended was at the four seasons as well. The passed OrDerv's were some of the best I've ever tasted the crab balls were fantastic. I don't even like lamb but the lollipop lamb chops were forced on me for a taste test, and I must admit I had three of them. They were outstanding. Well done to the staff and the team at four seasons

Pros: The hotel room is clean and it is spacious. The location is great. The man helped with my luggage is very nice.  Cons: However, the hotel is over priced for what it offers. The room is very out-dated, nothing will wow you within the hotel. No central lighting control in the room. The lift was making a weird sound and sudden stop which makes me feel like, it haven't been maintained for a while.  Most importantly, I am very disappointed at their service. There was a construction going on while I was there but no staff ever told me about it, I woke up due to the noise for 2 days before I called and found out what was going on. PLUS there was a renovation or something going on right outside my room, and I can smell the paint. Yet they didn't bother to let me know before I called them.  They managed to change the room for me to a upper level and apologized. But it is too late for that. I literally don't think they just "forgot" to tell me. Plus the old room looks right into an office in another building, you can literally see each other's face. If you want natural light then forget about privacy.  And their turn down service is... let me say doesn't make a difference.  Will not go back and don't suggest people to visit. FYI, I booked a suite. So imagine if you booked a superior room...

We travel to NYC every three months. Someone suggested we check out the Four Seasons on our next trip. We did and we were extremely impressed with the service in all areas. Great Service! Great Location! We definitely recommend this property when visiting Manhattan.

Normally I am beyond satisfied with this property. Currently under construction, this should of been notated in booking! I would not spend $1400 a night on any room where I can't sleep from the buzzing and hacking of tools! So upset over this trip. Room service has really gone down hill at this particular hotel.

Overall we had a pleasant stay at the hotel, but for $1000 a night you expect a quiet night sleep at the very least. If you stay at this hotel do not stay on a low floor and ask to be the other side from the nightclubs across the road....that's if you want sleep.

The Cleanliness of my Room left me with out words all employee's are so attentive it felt Unreal I was spoiled as I called the housekeeping to request an extra blanket Yvonne offered Me more amenities I was so impress due to the Service she provided to ME I received MORE THEN 5 STAR SERVICE FROM YVONNE SHE WOWED ME

This is a flagship hotel, not the best view of Central Park but the staff makes up for any loss. Enjoy the stay and peaceful quietness of your room at night. The hotel is in walking distance to Broadway and Times Square for any type of night life you are interested in.

This hotel is typical of most Four Seasons. It offers the comfort and elegance one would expect. However, it is New York City so you would expect it to be pricey! The staff is some of the best trained accommodating people I've have ever had the pleasure to meet. The surprising part is there is only one multi-purpose restaurant and an OK bar. The location, however, it "primo!" We were one block off Madison and around the corner from Trump Tower. The Theater District and many good restaurants are near by. Also, it is next door to Tau and across the street from Lavo! We would definitely give it another stay! Salute!

Spectacular!! Service is impeccable, location is the best, a perfectly pampering experience! Gorgeous rooms! Pricey but worth every penny!! I will stay here everytime I''m in NYC!! The gym is awesome too!! Treat yourself to this lovely experirnce.

Great service from the doormen, concierge, front desk, housekeeping to room service. All courteous and professional. We appreciated the baby stroller they gave us for the day. Breakfast at the garden restaurant was a bit pricey but expected at a place like that. Overall great place. Would definitely recommend.

Stayed at the Four seasons for 2 night getaway. I believe we stayed in the Gotham suite. Classic four seasons styling, state of the art curved television, very spacious bedroom area, decent city view, large bathroom, very clean, loved the room! Staff was nice but a bit bland at times. Kudos to their security measures at night. Very accommodating in bringing up coffee maker to the room and helping with all other requests. One of the better gyms I've seen in NYC hotels and great locker room facilities - steam, sauna, Jacuzzi (out of order). Great location. If it's in your budget I highly recommend it!

great hotel, good service, good rooms but no personal touch in reception or concierge... the breakfast is way too expensive for what it is value for money is rather poor i felt. we liked the location and the rooms...but will not come back and we do stay in ny about 20 nights a year.

On a scale of 1-10, 20! The staff, doorman, concierge, front desk, room service, spa, hotel...I could go on and on. This was our first trip to NYC and The 4 Seasons was one of top, most memorable, attractions. Simply outstanding. Thank you.

We planned a Mother's Day trip for our mothers starting 3 months ago when we acquired tickets to see Hamilton! We decided to stay at the four seasons because the service is incredible! And it has not disappointed us one bit. Both of our mothers are elderly and the team of professionals at every level have gone above and beyond to make sure our needs are being taken care of!

I've been staying at 4 Seasons NY ,several times a year, for over twenty five years. I've always loved it and have felt like I was coming home each time. Now I'm thinking maybe it's time to move on. Essentially everything is still lovely and they have redone a lot of the rooms. But has it helped? Not sure. Annoying drilling from above with no notification. Unbelievably expensive v simple breakfast room service. No longer bottles of water at turn down.Wash and blow dry in spa that are beyond belief expensive. It all has started to feel a little smug with itself. V sad to write like this but it feels like the end of a wonderful relationship.

Having read several reviews saying that this hotel is outdated, compared to other luxury destinations in Manhattan, I have to completely disagree. Here I could find all the main features you could expect from a Four Seasons, from an excellent location (5 minutes from Central Park and the infamous 5th avenue) to great staff and facilities.The best part was surely the room, with an amazing view over New York skyline, what you could call as the "wow" factor.The staff was also really helpful, and after the second night, they were already calling us by the first name, which is always a small, nice touch, which makes the difference from a great hotel to an average one.A special mention to the ladies at the SPA: they were amazingly helpful after a minor accident happened to one of my friend, who accidentally slippered in the steam room.If I would ever come back to New York City, this would be for sure my first choice.

Stayed there 4 nights for my birthday, the hotel is nice rooms are spacious for NY i believe but definitely not worth it.Have stayed in Four Seasons all over the world and chose them for their outstanding service unfortunately this hotel had very bad service. I will even think twice next time i book Four Seasons!

short welcome message / GM details it is expected coffee/tea facilities and few amenities should be standard being Four Seasons... one hour awaiting time to get shaving cream... housekeeping missing few dates... i had been closed inside the gym while working out!? on 28th we asked for complimentary car (which should be included in the room) to concierge which addressed me on the back side of the hotel. where I asked for the service and the bell boy answer 'no way' without checking for the car...so, while I asked for a taxi, he overstay 5' with a customer arrived after us. being disturbed from this attitude, we finally went to the front side to look for a taxi...while the complimentary car was parked without any commitment...very disappointing! almost the same happened again on 30th shower tap was broken concierge advise for outlet trip different than advised prior the arrival. at the check out nobody even asked me 'how was the stay?' or any other interested for our stay...

Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: My kids loved the buffet breakfast that they offer and so did I! They offer a wide range of cuisines so if you want ramen or bacon for breakfast, they have got you covered. I called in to housekeeping to say that my pillow was too hard. They gave me a scale of hardness that I would like and asked if I wanted a scented pillow! They really know how to look after you!

This is my favorite hotel in NYC and the room with the terrace is a must book. Why not have breakfast, dinner and just some us time on the terrace. The rooms are spacious, the staff is professional and accommodating. Centrally located near Central Park, and Upscale shopping stores.
user_name:
TheGlamLotus
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent stay and a Four Seasons through and through - the service was at the highest level, the room well presented and impeccable and concierge was superb. The location is perfect for business and a stroll from the park and the amenities around it. I don't hesitate to recommend it.

Just spent two nights here on a quick business trip. The front desk staff were outstanding; very friendly, efficient and professional. It was nice of the Four Seasons to upgrade my room...it is funny how those little things can really make your day! For NYC I found The hotel to be very elegant and modern. There are a lot of great names in NYC and I have had the pleasure to stay at quite a number of them but most have simply seen better days and, while full of character, need to renovated. Not the case with this property. The suite I had was spacious (especially for NYC), clean and generally well laid out. Lots of automation built into the room which was nice. The bedroom area was tastefully appointed and there was a very large flat panel tv that was perfect.The thing about a great hotel isn't really the rooms (I believe that a nice, clean, bright room with a top notch bathroom should be at every 4 or 5 star property)...it is the staff. Here is where this property excelled and stands out as a 5 star property in my opinion.I pay a lot of attention to how staff interact and treat guests during my stays...every person I encountered made eye contact and greeted me (sometimes by name) and it wasn't a fake corporate 'hello' it felt genuine. Also, the staff were always so helpful. From the doorman who lent me an umbrella, to the room service staff who got my meal to me in 25 min (I was running late) to the entire staff at their outstanding spa...everyone was friendly, helpful and seemed to really care that I was a guest...just outstanding!The only suggestion I would make is that I think a four season (or any 4/5 star property) should have a keurig type coffee machine in the room along with a few bottles of complimentary water. These tiny things were noticeable absent at this property.All in all, This property is a must stay if you are headed to NYC!Keep up the great work!

I've stayed at the Four Seasons NYC at least 25 times over the past 10 years. As time has gone on, I've watched the hotel become dated and less and less compelling relative to the other high end options in NYC. The service was still great and the location cannot be beat, but other elements were really showing their age: furniture, bathrooms, room technology, room service food options. Also the absence of a real restaurant that serves dinner is a big negative. What five star hotel doesn't have a restaurant or a proper bar? The only thing open at night is a sports lounge that is frequently loud and unwelcoming. Not that the hotel became bad, it just wasn't worth the $700-800/night that it charged, particularly relative to the new Park Hyatt next door or the new Four Seasons Downtown. Once the hotel began renovating, I stayed away from the noise, but had very high hopes for a renaissance.Having come back to the hotel post renovation, I am quite disappointed. To truly appreciate it, I booked the Gotham Junior Suite to see what the hotel was really like. I was in for a rude awakening. The hotel used the renovation as an excuse to relabel all their rooms. My "Gotham suite" was no different than a regular deluxe room from before. Same room, fancier name, but now a much higher price! This is deceit pure and simple. Moreover, the renovation is extremely underwhelming -- purely cosmetic. They changed carpets, furniture, wallpaper, and mirrors, and may be the TV. They didn't change any technology in the room (still can't open curtains from bed, for instance, or turn off the lights), and they didn't upgrade anything of substance. They didn't put double vanities even in their higher end "junior suites" -- this is pretty standard at this price range. Bathrooms are actually entirely untouched -- same as they looked 15 years ago. They also didn't reopen any restaurants or improve their room service menus. Other than a cosmetic revamp of the rooms, they changed very little. Even cosmetically they didn't get it right -- they kept a lot of the old wood trim, which now clashes with the new panels they installed. Very clear that they were pinching pennies in this "renovation" and doing as little as possible to claim that the hotel was renovated.So what do we have? A somewhat renovated hotel, with good service, bad food, still very much behind the times. And now at $1100 to $1400 per night. I don't mind paying for the best. But this simply isn't.

Service was excellent and they were so friendly to our toddler. It was my birthday and they put a little cake in the room, along with a little toy for the kid. Room was nice and the location is very convenient to midtown.

New York City, New York

review_body: Second stay in a new Studio 57 room. Although compact, the clever use of mirrors plus windows on two sides make these rooms very special, not to mention so bright you never need day time lighting - unlike too many low rise NYC hotels. Sole drawback? A safe which requires one to duck under all one's hanging clothes to access - not easy so whoever put them there obviously never uses a safe in a hotel!

Stunning decor in lobby/reception/bar areas. Loved the room, beautiful, and the bed was sublime. But these days you expect twin sinks in the bath. However, not at all satisfied with the food or food service. We had Sunday Brunch and will never eat there again.

I just spent 4 nights at the FS. As the title states, location is great, the renovated rooms are very nice and well equipped. Service was also top notch throughout the property. My only complaint is the breakfast. $100+ for avocado and poached egg breakfast for two is a bit pricey even by NY standards. The avocado was not to be found...it turned out to be a watery pharmacy-food-section-grade guacamole. There was no reaction by the waitstaff when we signaled our disappointment with the food. We wound up having breakfast elsewhere for the rest of our stay.Our favorite NY hotel continues to be The Mark.

Service was impeccable and the food outstanding. Was there for a work part - 100 guests, and I was very impressed with how smoothly everything ran. Also the Christmas tree in the lobby is stunning. Will definitely return!Great location near 5th Avenue. Staff is the friendliest without being overbearing. Room is splendid! Quiet, understated luxury, the way it should be.

review_body: This place just does everything right! From check in...to last minute seamstress to fix a hem...to check out...they ROCK! For a great stay in mid town, they stand out as the BEST. While not inexpensive, the price-value equation is very much in line!
