Mirror Lake, New Hampshire

review_body: A great hotel that gives personal attention to its visitors. The concierge was excellent in helping us avoid long lines at tourist places and finding the right places for dinners. Great location. We will be back.

The Four Seasons NYC is a fabulous hotel. The staff and everything about this hotel is first class. The concierges are fantastic with their recommendations for things to do, restaurants and travel arrangements. The location is perfect for shopping, restaurants and close by to the airport. I rate it A++.

Came for a long weekend in NYC. It's been years since I stayed in the Four Seasons. They completed a major renovation this past year and I was excited to see the makeover. Wow, what a change for the positive! Rooms are large, airy and tastefully appointed. My favorite thing about the FS is that it is upscale without being stuffy. The new room layouts are gorgeous. Simple, but effective. Hot, full on showers. Nice closets. Beautiful 4K tv on the wall. Bed that was impossible to get out of as it was so comfortable. Service was fantastic as to expected, but even there, housekeeping, concierge and room service all went out if their way to make my stay apecial. Loved it. Will definitely be back soon!

I have tried foe four seasons and this one has the best view. The service is pretty good and we make you feel the four seasons experience. However, the room dining menu for all day food is not big enough and a few things are missing.However, overall I will recommend it!

We spent 5 nights there. Everything was excellent. The hotel arranged a car from the airport, check in was easy there were no issues. The staff were great especially the concierges . We did have one issue when the concierge arranged to have a car take us to the airport on our departure, but none arrived as they had booked the wrong date. We then had to hustle and get a taxi. To management credit they telephoned me as soon as I arrived home and apologized offering a complementary car on my next arrival. I do have one grumble with the hotel. They need to have a Nespresso machine in the room and also bottled water. This is the standard all over the world.Otherwise we had a very enjoyable trip

The Four Seasons NYC didn't disappoint once again. New rooms, every employee attentive to the guest.Definitely a solid choice for business or personal stay. Great location so you can walk to so many places/restaurants.

This is a beautiful hotel. I had a Junior Suite which was large and had a great BathtubThe food in the restaurant was great. Pricey. Ut delicious. Lunch menu coukd have had a few more choices. In room dining was delicious.

Spent three nights at the FS in March and had a fabulous time. The room was beautifully appointed, and very comfortable; it was a girls trip and we needed a rollaway bed, which happened to be mine for the trip, and very comfy! Each and every employee was so helpful and friendly; even the doorman who had to stand out in the rain and cold! He was smiling and friendly despite the weather.The staff at the concierge desk, Clancy, David, Emmanuel, and Randy, were so accommodating in acquiring dinner reservations and Book of Mormon show tickets (which was hilarious). They made GREAT recommendations for dining and we enjoyed every meal. As this was my first trip to NY, David gave me tips on how to hail a cab after the show, and I nailed it like a pro!! Thanks David!Thanks to the entire staff for treating us like VIPs and making our trip fun and memorable.

The hotel is excellent and love staying in it. I have stayed at this hotel a numbers of time and each occasion was enjoyable. We like the loacation, media services and gym. The location is so idea to Central Park and Madison Avenue and the hearty of the financial district

We used to stay at this hotel a lot between 2008-2010, then we started staying at other properties during our 2-3 times per year visits to NYC. We decided to give the Four Seasons a try again this time and we were very pleased. The rooms are a very generous size by NYC standards, and they have been recently renovated.

The overall service of the staff was excellent. The Door Men and Room Service Staff were great. The room was very well maintained. I would like to see "fresh fruit" offered upon arrival as opposed to weeks old fruit that no-one actually wants to eat. However, the technology, cleanliness and overall service was what I would expect for a Four Seasons. The location is superb as well.

Great location and service. Food was so good. Room was super clean. Johannes the Concierge was an amazing. he went above and beyond. a little bit expensive but it wroth it. doormen and bellmen were well informed.We will be back soon !

Stayed at this hotel maybe 5 times in the last 2 years. Always good. Rooms were recently renovated. View was stunning, bar was amazing. Food in the hotel was great. Breakfast was good but nothing special. Bar was excellent.

Still the best facility, location and service in NYC. I have stayed here more times than I can count and I am never disappointed. The recent upgrades and refurbishment of the rooms adds quality to the elegance that already existed.

specially their hospitality is the best.....:) friendly behave, honorable service, latest technology, good food and everything is near by. enjoyed very much staying with them. would love to stay here again.

Wonderful hotel. I always stay at Four Seasons on worldwide travel. My only surprise was to find that there was no coffee maker or complimentary bottled water available in our room. This is the first Four Seasons I have ever stayed at that had neither. I had to order two bottles of water and ice from room service and it was $60. Come on....

In New York for a quick business trip and never wanted to leave my room! From the luxurious marble bathroom to the plush bedding a place to truly nestle in and hibernate. I thought the location, fantastic entrance, and ty lounge were enough to make it a 5 star experience but then, the food! I had room service and I was hungry! I ordered a few items as my eyes were large than my stomach, the portions were amazing. One would have been plenty but then I would have never seen the salad! Chicken Cobb with the best presentation I've seen! Oh and the room service server was right- best burger ever! Kudos Four Seasons Central Park- amazing stay! Also I could not forget to mention the people, from concierge to door men, so many genuinely nice and helpful people! No comparison- stay here- The Best!

Spent my 35th birthday here and it is the most elegant hotel in the city. Stunning rooms with amazing decor. Joanna at the front desk was extraordinary. Thanks so very much for an amazing experience!cant wait to come again

Besides being very pricey, my family and I had a fabulous stay at the Four Seasons in New York. The location is perfect for tourists because it's walking distance to everything you'd like to see (Time Square, Central Park, Moma Museum, Met Museum) and if you'd like to visit anything else the concierge will organise it in a heartbeat. We went to a lovely Asian Fusian restaurant around the corner from the hotel as well as a breakfast diner, both recommended by the staff and we enjoyed both meals very much. As I mentioned before it's pricey to stay at the Four Seasons - especially in New York, but it was well worth the money we paid.

If you have a disability or need an accessible room, you should stay elsewhere. This hotel is wonderful - incredibly great staff - just like other Four Seasons I have stayed at. But the accessible rooms are a disaster. The problem is the bathroom floor. The floor is not sloped towards the drain, so shower water floods the entire bathroom and even gets to the edge of the room's carpeted floor. Water pools around the toilet and elsewhere, making it slippery to make your way around after a shower. Exactly what you don't need in an accessible bathroom. The hotel is aware of the problem. It appears that their renovation contractor botched the floors in all their accessible rooms. They tried to patch the issue by adding a lip at the shower entrance, but that was useless in our room. The best we could do was to arrange 4-5 towels like sand bags around the shower. Until they pull up the bathroom floors and grind them down to drain properly, I will not return to this property if I need an accessible room again.Other than this issue with the room, the hotel was great. Staff is phenomenal. Location is great. Would not hesitate to stay here if I needed a normal room.

We visited for New Years weekend and although it was only my second visit there in a year, they received us like "regulars". All of the concierge staff was excellent, but Roland went above and beyond. We were directed to the most delicious restaurants, we had the best time. Everyone from Housekeeping to the Bellmen to the Front Desk staff was top notch. The gym has water bottle am apples, and great equipment. I had a fabulous facial downstairs, and my only complaint would be 13.00 coffee at the restaurant. This will be an annual destination for us.

The Four Seasons Hotel was a wonderful choice for us to celebrate my wifes birthday. It is located perfectly for Central Park and in walking distance of lots of major attractions. Fifth Avenue is a 5 minute walk and has lots of bars, shops and restaurants right on the door step. The hotel itself is a true 5 star. The level of service was exceptional from the door staff, concierge, front desk to the maid service. All in all a truly wonderful place to stay and see New York. The Garden restaurant and the TY bar were brilliant. We wouldn't have wished for anything else on this remarkable trip.

Kimberly at the front desk is fantastic and accomadated our needs perfectly! We needed a early check in and a late check out and she made it happen. It made a big difference in the quality of our stay.

We love our stay in Four Seasons... be it in Langkawi or New York, the service is definitely the best and make us truly comfortable throughout. The staff were very attentive and well mannered.Luxury at its best.Love it!

I do like this hotel in New York I paid $4000 a night for a perfect two bedroom suite for our family of 4. At turn down though in every hotel there is no water left , at breakfast to get fresh orange juice you pay more , there is no water offered complementary at no filter water not very green but very greedy . It's a shame that a hotel like this so obviously counts it's pennies . For internet to get it faster you pay extra The service has been great our room was wonderful . Concierge helpful no complaints but you know how to charge the highest prices but you give nothing away and don't just go the extra mile .

Excellent service, beautiful rooms, great location. Definitely the place to stay while in New York. Loved the staff, everyone was very friendly. Room service was prompt and on time. Oh, and they had the best strawberries!!!xoxo

Amazing stay at the Four Seasons. Everything we asked for they were able to answer with a positive answer. We loved the Rolls Royce courtesy car and made great use of it. The suite was splendid and the view breathtaking. The location of the hotel is ideal (Madison & 57th). We previously stayed at the property in Bora Bora and found the service to be excellent, New York didn't disappoint us.Lubna one of the concierge made our stay even more memorable, she's the incarnation of dedication and friendliness. The only thing that prevent us to stay in a regular manner at Four Seasons propriety is the lack of reward program. I'm diamond with Hilton program and I'd gladly change for four seasons if they had one. We stayed at the Four Seasons Bora Bora in the past so we had high expectations, we were not disappointed at all!

This hotel was super fun. Had a great new York feel to it and vibe. Service was excellent, food delicious, hotel very pretty. We had a huge suite and a balcony overlooking Central Park. It was gorgeous and we really enjoyed our stay.

Okay, okay, so I like alliteration. Look, I've stayed in a bunch of NYC hotels but somehow never stayed in this hotel. From now on, despite being a fairly loyal Ritz Carlton frequenter, I will stay at this hotel.When you walk into the lobby, you don't have any of the dissonance you find at the Ritz Carlton Central Park (although the Battery Park location is better). It is quiet and more subdued.One of the only drawbacks of the Four Seasons is walking up the steps as soon as you enter the lobby, but that's really the only negative of the place.The staff is very friendly, very accommodating. Can't do enough for you. The Concierge desk is excellent, and I must applaud Tina particularly for her help in ever-changing restaurant reservations.The room is flawless. Clean, spacious (in NYC!) and quiet. The HVAC system is quiet, the noise from the street subdued because the streets aren't that busy. Sure, I had some noisy people next door playing some kind of music but even that was manageable.Location is terrific. Very well situated. All in all, this place gets Dimmy's Coveted Five Star Rating (as if anyone really cared).I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Our stay started with a disastrous misunderstanding - a Terrace Central Park view suite that we have booked 4 months in advance was not available upon our arrival. At first we were offered a suite of a lower category - without a terrace, though the latter was of primary importance. We were a party of 3 people so for a night we were placed in 2 standart terrace rooms on a lower floor with no view (one room couldn't accomodate all of us). I worte a complaint to our agency and to the general director of the hotel. The next day we were offered to choose (free of charge) suites of the same category in different 5 star hotels but after checking the options we have decided to remain in Four Seasons. As a compensation we got substantial discount on both rooms + breakfast inclusion + limousine for saturday night and numerous minor gifts. Overall this was a satisfactory compensation fot the mistake made. About the hotel - location is perfect - in the very heart of Manhattan, very convenient. Concierge service - perfect. All requests were handled immediately and very effectively. It was a pity not to have the planned suite, since the view should have been just amazing. Will be happy to come again to live there. From the negative side - extremely expensive breakfast with horrible service. If not included in the room, better not to go there. One of the worst breakfasts I ever had. Pure dissatisfaction.

Christmas trip, fantastic view over central park. The service & facilities in room are superb. But the location is what makes staying here special, everything is quite close & we found it within walking distance. Absolutely loved the hotel, but then I'm a big fan of Four Seasons hotels.

best hotel in NYC.If you also want to have a great massage then you should go there. We had our best massage ever and we travel a lot because of business.the place of the hotel is also perfect. you are directly in the shopping mall. you can safe much money for taxi when you sleep here.for us its the best hotel in New York. We will come back for sure soon.

Everything about our experience was perfect. The bed was completely divine - I slept so well - and the amenities in the room were 1st rate ... huge big bath, super rain shower, lovely bathroom in general. We had a beautiful view of Central Park. Breakfast was delicious. Room service was so attentive. The front of house staff could not have been more helpful. A truly 5 star luxury hotel.... and a perfect location midtown.

The four seasons NY is what you would expect from a 5 star hotel nice classy lobby and stylish rooms. The lobby is very modern and had a nice big Christmas tree in the middle that adds to the decor. The atmosphere is luxurious. The rooms are very nice and spacious with nice toiletries and services. Again, its what you would expect from a Four Seasons hotel

Nestled in the heart of New York City, this Four Seasons hotel is the perfect stay for those travelers looking for luxury. Like all FS hotels, the building was impressively decorated with impeccable, modern taste. The rooms are beautiful, with a large bathroom and comfortable beds. One afternoon we ordered room service, and the food came hot and fresh. Of course, it was all superb. You can tell the workers truly care about providing the best service to their residents.

Stayed here for three nights for some business in the city. Got a great, just renovated room on 43rd floor. Great room, even better views. Amazing stay.Staff is really polite and prompt. Internet works great

This is by far the best hotel in New York and chain in the world to be quite honest. Victor at the front desk is amazing and truly goes above and beyond the line of duty. I am honored to be a guest at this hotel and again, tip my hat off to Victor and the rest of the staff here as well.

Spent one night at the Four Seasons on a business trip in December. The only drawback was security around nearby Trump hotel made traffic in the area even worse than usual during the holiday season. Service was fantastic. My room wasn't ready for early check-in, so the staff collected my luggage and delivered it to the room when ready. They also sent me a text to let me know as soon as it was ready. Fantastic service, a huge (for New York), comfortable room. Top notch. Bring your wallet.

Staff is very nice. Checkin/checkout very quick. But third year in a row with a terrible view or should I say no view 1st Year a view of rooftop of air conditioning units and this year I was looking directly into someone's office. No mini bar even tho I was given a key to one and there was a minibar menu in the room. Not even a bottle water by bed.

Stayed at several FS hotels before and they allways deliver. From start to finish you`re welcomed by friendly and attentive staff.Our room was not ready when we arrived which was nicely compensated with a upgraded room. Made the whole wait less annoying.Concierge arranged several things for us and everything went smooth.Event thou it is an expensive hotel it gives you a good feeling of value for your money.

I stayed for a week and the quality standard has always been high.I let myself be pampered by your breakfasts, and your attention to detail and 'fantastic.as always is difficult to return to normalitySee you soon on my next trip to ny

I have stayed here several times now and this last time I was a little peeved that I had an awful view from my room. I realize that it's New York and it's tough to get around the tall buildings but there was one so close out my window. I have had the same class room there before with a much better view so I was disappointed to say the least. I would have thought that for returning customers, this might be taken into consideration. Especially with what the rooms cost. And I have stayed at the FS in San Francisco, Paris, Florence, and London. Having said that, the staff is wonderful and the hotel ambience is lovely. Just don't know if I will go back to this one the next time I go to New York.

My husband and I travelled to NY for his 50th during December. Great time to be in NY with all the holiday decor. Our stay at the Four Seasons was great, as they knew we were coming for his birthday they had upgraded our room and had a birthday cake in the room for him. Great hotel, great location, great breakfast, great staff... well recomended

My husband I just returned from a quick weekend in NYC. We returned to the FS after a terrible stay in the summer of 2015. I wrote a pretty scathing review at the time because I was appalled at how neglected the rooms were. We were invited back to stay at the hotel now that the majority of the renovation is complete. Without any hesitation, the hotel has done a complete turnaround. The rooms are light and airy (although the bathrooms still have those weird French doors), that make the rooms feel like they are floating over the skyline. The color scheme is modern and clean without feeling sterile or plain. The corridors are also lovely. A similar color scheme to the rooms. The entire hotel simply feels fresh. The trouble that we had with turn-down last time had been fixed; there was fresh water from both daytime housekeeping and turn-down service. Last time there was no water to be had and when we asked for some, we were charged. Although, still no chocolates. The FS in Chicago still does chocolates, but the water is in plastic bottles. Glass bottles for water though is a very nice touch.

Superdoc had always wanted to spend Christmas in New York so we booked into the Four Seasons for a long weekend in early December.The hotel is very elegant with great staff, effortless luxury and a real wow factor. Our room, which was upgraded for free, was superb with a sight-line to Central Park and the location is superb!We had one breakfast in our room which actually was much better than the breakfast we had on our first morning in the restaurant, though the restaurant manager was very kind to us when we mentioned a few issues. We also had one lunch in the restaurant on arrival - both tucked into a large and very tasty burger with a side of crispy fries and mac-and-cheese. Naughty but nice!!!The tree in the entrance lobby was beautiful and all in all our stay lived up to Superdoc's every wish. The best!

If you are looking for luxury, above and beyond customer service, diversity, amazing bars and restaurants...the Four seasons has it all. If budget isn't an issue this is the place to be in New York. It's location and amazingly friendly staff, amenities and services make the experience one of a kind. Highly recommend trying their French toast for breakfast.
